Reviews.Title: “The Best Night's Sleep in Rome”
Reviews.Author: danduf225
Reviews.Content: We actually visited this hotel in August 2007. This hotel has a great location, right in the centre of the city. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Once upon a time, this must have been a great hotel. But the grandeur is fading a little bit. Nevertheless, our room was great. Quiet and restful, no doubt aided by the fact that we had a room with a courtyard view. The comfortable bed was amazing, I wish I could have brought it home with me. The lavish breakfast was good, but the coffee wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Our first hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Winesurgeon
Reviews.Content: The first time we went to Rome was in 1984, this hotel was chosen, so fantastic, interior classic and a garden inside in the middle, wow! We have been there 3 times after all the times the service was very fine and this hotel give us so many great moment, we still talk about how it were. These days we have been to Rome about 10 times, but this Grand Hotel Plaza is still a very special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Travelled Feb 2012 - Take this as an honest review!!!”
Reviews.Author: jasethetravelagent
Reviews.Content: Here’s a basic frank and honest review of this Hotel. Looking to contract this hotel for our Tour Operation in the UK, I went largely “under-cover” , here’s the feedback. The best positioning anyone could ask for – for people (even like myself that do not relish the fact of trawling around a large City) – I can honestly say it was ideally positioned on a) the main shopping street and b) for all into designer shops -right on the door-step !! and more importantly for what most come to Rome for c) the Historic attractions of this great City. The Spanish Steps are the nearest attraction (basically out of the hotel turn left and there they are!!) (2mins away). The furthest away being the Vatican (30 min leisurely stroll) PLEASE NOTE ROME IS FLAT AND IDEAL FOR EVERYONE!! The Grand Plaza Hotel – yes it has the wow factor of design and history. We found the staff (on all occasions) extremely helpful. The rooms were typically historic and what one would expect in Rome. The main lounge – wow! – simply stunning – (one thing is that it only lacked music!!) – this should be 24 hours – Grand Plaza, please take note. Would we recommend it – yes! Will we be contracting it – yes! Loved the stay, had a great time and to be honest - it’s the kind of hotel you will never really forget. I have read some of the below reviews – one who states they are “very well travelled” ???? Maybe they didn’t stay at this hotel as I (working in the industry) - found little to criticize – even the breakfast spread was great!! That took me by surprise too! Oh – take a look at the Terrace on the 5th Floor – if you visit in the Summer months – I can only imagine perfect!! In a hotel like this – one has to accept certain things (which quite honestly are that insignificant, I don’t’ wish to take time mentioning) but I can honestly say, overall this Hotel is worthy of it’s Italian 5* rating (I give it that for the historic décor alone!) Food and drink – at the time we visited, we both eat in nice establishments for around £50-60 Euro (for both) - including a bottle of wine and a few beers ( I considered it extremely reasonable !!) – If you look harder, you will find cheaper places too.

Reviews.Title: “living in a museum”
Reviews.Author: alexandra_antonia
Reviews.Content: the architecture of the hotel is absoulutely amazing as is its location so if you're in Rome you should go in and see it! the staff is very nice and helpful but that being said, no one likes to live in a cold museum. this was supposed to be a 5 star hotel but my room was cold, the furniture was very old and not reconditioned. there was no iron and ironing board available in the room which didn't give the impression of being very clean either. but the most shocking thing was that the checkout time was 10 am.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I've had in Europe in 20 years of traveling”
Reviews.Author: weebarona
Reviews.Content: Grand Plaza location is excellent but the service is horrible. I paid $607 EU/night for a lovely jr suite with a balconey. The bed is so hard I did not sleep for 6 nights. The pillows are like lead; the sheets itch; the towels are holiday in quality; amenities are few and cheap in the bath. There is no concierge. No one answers the phone for room service. The front desk is run by one person who most of the time is rude. There is no doorman; one bellman for the hotel. They leave dirty glasses in the room. There is no evening maid service. They chain the hotel at midnight. They have no diea who their guests are and clearly don't care. It was a huge and very expensive mistake! Don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Location and grandeur +++”
Reviews.Author: kickkwok
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for my landmark birthday, with my toddler and other half. We chose to splash out a little bit because of this, and chose this hotel due to the location and because of the reviews regarding it's grand decor. I had already read a few reviews, so I knew not to expect perfect finishes to the decor. On arrival, the reception staff were polite, but appeared slightly absentminded at times. It was difficult to tell if they were concentrating on what you were saying, as they appeared to be multitasking a lot of the time, and didn't make the time to gesture to acknowledge your existence. However, it was only a small grumble. The staff for the remainder of the stay were very attentive, very toddler friendly and helpful. We had to go to the bar to buy milk for our baby bottle, and the gentleman behind the bar was very friendly, polite and helpful enough to warm it up. The room we were given was beautiful. It was a suite, and had a sofa bed, which we used for our toddler. The only bug bear was, after the first night, my son had a little accident on the bed, so we took the sheets off and left them on the floor of the bathroom, hoping they would understand that they needed replacing. Unfortunately, from the smell of the sheets later that night, they put those sheets back on the sofa bed, so we had to bring him into our bed that night. The breakfast was included with our booking. It was a buffet, with some pastries, sausage and cereals. Not the best range of breakfast buffet I've had, but the room decor made up for it. It was like eating in the ballroom in the Sound of Music. I definitely did not regret staying here. The location was perfect (round the corner from the spanish steps) and the grandiosity of the place was breath taking. We spent a while every day, just sitting and looking at it all.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and glamorous”
Reviews.Author: romeshopper35
Reviews.Content: Twin bedroom. Was surprised that room was more like a suite with walk in corridor and elegant sofa with very high ceiling. Room facing courtyard. Seemed freshly painted. Bathroom had a bathtub. Breakfast room glamorous but somewhat overdecorated. If you paid tax beforehand bring credit card receipt. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “This is honest feedback from a well traveled couple.”
Reviews.Author: Claire H
Reviews.Content: We toured Italy in September 2011 visiting Venice, Florence, Rome, Pisa, Sorrento and Sicily all in 5 star accommodation. So we were really looking forward to visiting Rome for 4 days in what appeared to be a beautiful grand hotel in the Heart of Rome, we couldn't be more wrong if we tried! We stayed for three evenings and believe it or not we had three different bedrooms due to the fact their cleaners must have been on strike for the past 3 years!!! Dirty, filthy and very poorly maintained is just the start of the list. Highlights of the hotel include; ======================= a) In all three rooms there were electrical wires hanging from the walls particularly in the bathrooms. b) The wall next to the sink in all three bathrooms included the previous guests toothpaste slashes. c) The bed had a bedframe added to make it look nice, but was not attached?! d) Light switches that simply do nothing. d) ear bud on floor in hallway for 2 days!!!! e) There were stained cots/matress just dumped in the main hallway!!!!!!!!! f) Both elevators had a broken rail and were smashed up beyond repair. g) the safe... ok, this was not safe, I could walk around the room with it, or even out the front door of the building as no security existed and it was not fastened to anything. Also whilst on, after putting our valuables in it, the lock combination brown and we had to wait for the 1 maintenance man (didn't speak English) and missed breakfast. h) If you like breakfast, get there fast, because once the juice/milk/everything runs out, they simply don't replace it. i) Air conditioning (when it works) is noisy, in fairness this was not a problem in our first room due to the fact it simply didn't work at all. j) In our final deluxe room (this was an upgrade), the TV cable does not reach the TV socket, so don't expect to watch TV. k) unsurprisingly the hotel Manager is never available. l) Even on arrival we felt ignored by the receptionist who carry on with other administrative duties when a queue is growing! In summary without lying or joking this is actually a 3 star at a push, please please don't even think you will slightly enjoy this hotel, it really is the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. It desperately need to be closed for a full refurb, and actually employ some cleaners that clean! Like we said originally we stayed in REAL 5 star hotels throughout Italy and this one is so far off the mark its untrue. ps. no refund was offered in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Need to be closed for "maintenance"”
Reviews.Author: mona s
Reviews.Content: i have been in the hotel in year 1999, and NOTHING had changed The bathroom is really old and some parts really need replacement, there is noting in the hotel that gives it five stars hotel the location is great, but to maintain the rate, the hotel will need more friendly staff and who talk other language than Italian

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanneevans71
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel , bathroom let it down, no shower just a shower hose in bath so had to stand in bath and hold it ! No coffee facilities , breakfast ok

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul1919
Reviews.Content: My Family And I Have Traveled Around the world a few times and stayed at a lot of hotels, especially in europe and it can be hit and miss and what you see on web sites can be different to what you get. we were happy with what we got and it had a great location. Had two rooms with court yards which gave as a little extra space. The rooms were clean and well equiped howver a little small, but still okay. Room service was quick and the breakfast was great. Front office staff good, however had one which was a little agrivating. Our safe in our room was not bolted down so in the compendium it states that they are not responsible for anything left in the safe, however they have safes at reception. We went down to reception and this guy looked at us as if we were stupid and proceeded to tell us that we had a safe in the room, so why dont you use that. We explained that it was not bolted down so its not that good and so the compendium states that you have more secure safes at reception. My wife can speak italian, which he did not know and so he porceeded to mumble in italian and so my wife turned around and told him in italian that we were not impressed with him and that he should be more friendly to guets. Apart from that i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous rome break”
Reviews.Author: ashpretani
Reviews.Content: Mega huge, Magnificent family suite on the 5th floor with balcony views over the city towards Saint Peters, Very spacious, clean and traditionally elegant. Breakfast included, my only downside is too many sweet options on the buffet and insufficeint savoury, but a personal niggle really. The kids ate well Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, good english and very tolerent of our Italian attempts. Most main sights within easy walking, great food and shopping options locally, well priced for central Rome,

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary K
Reviews.Content: The staff were nice and the hotel is in a great location for shopping and seeing the sights but it is over priced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Never 5 star in a million years”
Reviews.Author: JemScott
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Saturday night in your hotel which I booked as an end to our cruise and as a “touch of luxury” for my wife as it was her birthday. Prior to our cruise we stayed at the Quirinale a 4 star hotel near you and expected a lot more form a 5 star Luxe property as purported by your website and the significantly higher prices charged. We were very disappointed. The below points are not what I expect in a 5 star hotel On arrival we were not met by any porter and had to make our own way into the hotel with 16 suitcase between the 8 of us - Not 5 star We had a very long wait at reception whilst the 1 check-in person attended a long line and the concierge was busy re-arranging a client flights. This didn’t seem a one-off as every time we passed the area there was a long queue My in-laws room (411) was tiny and our “family apartment” had 2 double beds..why would a family want that. Surely they want a double for the parents and twins for the kids. When I asked for a cot I was told I couldn’t have one as it wouldn’t fit...... The bathroom in the 3rd room, once we killed the ants, had elements of the bathroom not working. Most 5 start hotels check all the facilities of the room, including light bulbs prior to occupation. In the morning we went to have breakfast which was exceptionally poor. No fresh cut fruit except prunes, No hot food to accompany the eggs. I have stayed in many many 5 star hotels and do find Italy overgenerous on its grading but they need to be corrected as you are selling on a misconception and misleading clients The only thing 5 star were the bar price at €10 for a Gin and Tonic. You may benefit from looking at the competitors as the Quirinale was a better hotel for much less money and the stay with you defeated the object of giving my a treat for her birthday. You grade yourself, albeit with different prices, the same as the St. Regis, Baglioni and others which is just not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a museum”
Reviews.Author: TheBoyscout
Reviews.Content: I was here a few years ago and this was one of the more memorable hotels I have stayed in. There is so much detail in everything from the floors to the ceiling. Everything inside looked like a work of art, including the rooms. Our room was very large and the bathroom was also very spacious. Everything was clean and in good order. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included with the room price and was very good. My only gripe was that the wooden floors were creeky in some spots of our room but those issues were minor compared to how great everything else was. I definitely will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “looking forward to May”
Reviews.Author: ladnick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have always enjoyed our stays at the "Grand". We are now planning to celebrate our 60th wedding anniversary in Europe in May 2012, and will end our trip in Rome. We of course will stay at the "Grand" once again. The hotel IS grand, and we always enjoyed how friendly and helpful the staff was. I was reminded of that during my email correspondence with Paola Licciardello, the hotel's sales manager, who helped me arrange my forthcoming stay in a manner that made me feel that I was dealing with an old friend, notwithstanding the fact that we have never met. Typical. Stanley Gold / Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Great returning this year”
Reviews.Author: Christine T
Reviews.Content: Four years ago we stayed at the Plaza with two grandchildren. We had excellent rooms offered at a reduced rate. The service was perfect, excellent breakfast was much enjoyed and the spacious, well appointed sitting rooms are one of the reasons why we are returning with a much larger party this year.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting A Beautiful Grandmother In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Westoz60
Reviews.Content: Thank you to everyone at the Grand Hotel Plaza in Rome for your wonderful hospitality which my wife and I experienced in July this year. We had traveled across Italy by train the day we arrived and we were very hot and tired by the time we reached the hotel. Even though we were hot and tired we were welcomed like family...Being able to refresh ourselves in your comfortable, clean and pleasant surroundings was a highlight of our visit to Rome. The room was clean and comfortable and quiet and very well prepared. Our huge bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed sinking into the fresh soft pillows to have a refreshing sleep. We enjoyed the fabulous breakfast in the gracious dining room and the staff were highly attentive and pleasant to us at all times. Please pass on our thanks to your desk staff for their patience and understanding with my attempts to speak Italian and for their helpful advice to us in exploring and enjoying the culture and beauty of Italy. From the time we booked the hotel over the internet before leaving home until the moment we left, the service we received was the best any hotel could offer. The hotel's magnificent reception rooms and bar area were great places to enjoy a quiet retreat from the busy streets of Rome. Once we stepped out the door, the location was ideal to go shopping, sightseeing or to have a meal. It was a very enjoyable visit and we will certainly look forward to visiting your hotel again, one day in the future.

Reviews.Title: “really bad choice”
Reviews.Author: nadia65
Reviews.Content: it was only the location which made me choose this hotel plus i didn't find a room in my favorite hotel in rome ( intercontenintal / via sistina ) at that time , i was surprised from the very begining about every thing .. the rooms were in a bad condition and has no amenities at all .. they even have no tissue paper in the house keeping .. the staff were as if they were forced to do their jobs , i have much more to say since i stayed there for 8 days .. in short .. it was a bad surprise and i wonder how come they call it a five stars hotel ?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, air conditioned, and spacious rooms. Very 'European'”
Reviews.Author: fourkids12,14,11,3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Grand. We had stayed about 7 years ago when it was under different name. The hotel is a very excellent location we think. We are a family of 6 ( 4 children ages 19, 17, 12, 8) It is easy walk to many attractions, has excellent bistros ( turn right out the front door and look up the next 2 streets for oodles of outdoor cafes) . Turn left out the front door and you are on the main strip for all the top designers shops: Gucci, YSL, Prada..... The top of that strip if you keep walking 2 blocks, is the Spanish steps and that is where there are horse and buggy rides, and zillions of taxis. There is a huge buffet breakfast with friendly wait staff. The lobby and entire main floor are like a palace. There is beautiful detailed architecture. It is worth it to stay at this hotel just to have the privilege to bask in the beauty of the lobby! Our rooms did not adjoin: they did join the last time we visited however. The ceilings in the rooms probably are 20 feet high, so there is a grand and spacious feeling. The room is very well air conditioned also. The Hotel staff are all friendly and helpful. The furniture is old but in keeping with the age of the hotel. The rooms are lovely, but nothing compared to the lobby. You will feel like you are a guest in a palazzo/villa perhaps. Big old wood floors covered with large wool rugs. We will stay there again for sure. The only poor experience we had was with the cleaning lady: when we were leaving she was standing at the doorway waiting to come in.... she went in the room and exclaimed loudly and angrily ( so we would hear it ) " MAMA MIA!!!" At least that made the kids laugh. We are not sure why she did that, I think maybe because my daughter had left her bath towels on the floor in the bathroom, and all trash didn't make the can in the washroom; the only other thing could be that we didn't make the beds? Not sure what her beef was because we do not speak Italian. It was the only negative experience we had there, not even really worth mentioning. The front desk service was excellent, and eager to help. By european standards it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful venue, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lars48
Reviews.Content: We had two full days of business meetings at the hotel, including a lunch for 100 persons, other smaller meetings with food served, and guest rooms for 12 persons, most staying three or more nights. No one staying at the hotel or attending our meetings had a complaint about their rooms - all were very satisfied, and all are seasoned travelers. The hotel guests and attendees loved the beautiful public and meeting spaces; the food was excellent; the location was close to sights, shopping, and the subway; and the staff was very attentive to our needs. We hold meetings like these twice annually and have visited many international locations over the last 14 years. We've had a few unpleasant experiences, so I regularly check TripAdvisor before making arrangements. While I was initially concerned about a few negative past reviews, our experience exceeded our expectations, and we wouldn't hesitate to return to the hotel or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, rundown, rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: digdog901
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be downgraded to a two star hotel. Our room was dirty, The paint was chipping off the walls and the walls were dirty. The carpet was wet and full of dust.The Air conditioner was broken and it was over 95. The bathroom tile was full of mold. The staff at the front desk consists of two people trying to help several people at a time both of whom were not friendly. We complained and were told that there were no other rooms available. Guess there were many others that believed the pictures on the internet and the 5 star rating. The breakfast was minimal with stale bread. I would suggest looking at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: JGDJs
Reviews.Content: 4 days in Rome and not one form of mechanised transport. Rome is old and characterful and you get a part of that with this hotel which adds to the charm. Yes, so we had a suite on the fifth floor with fabulously large teracces overlooking St Peter's in one direction and a view to the Spanish Steps behind - for the price the accommodation was generous. Agreed, the air conditioning could have been a bit more efficient - perhaps it was the original system invented by the Romans 2000 years ago without the aid of electricity!! But the room was perfectly clean. The front desk could do with a bit more help at certain times and could be brusque, the cleaners were very riendly but otherwise we had little interaction with the staff since we were being tourists!!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Old Dame of Rome”
Reviews.Author: June1199
Reviews.Content: If you want "modern" don't stay in this hotel. The decor is fabulous but not modern. We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and were hesitant after reading the reviews. Our room was like a suite - really large and comfortable. The bathroom was equally spacious. The daily room service was excellent and we loved the grand feeling of the hotel. We spent some time on the roof garden which was a mass of bougainvillas and flowers and could not have been a more relaxing place to sit and read a book. The location is great and the staff were polite and helpful. My only comments are that a little more time should be spent maintaining minor things like where the carpet met the wall it was frayed in some places - around the bottom of the bathroom skirting it needed tidying up. These are the things that people notice and result in bad reviews. Breakfast was in a wonderful old room with beautifully starched white tableclothes and fresh flowers on the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand”
Reviews.Author: Peerkbh
Reviews.Content: This property certainly is impressive - especially the ball room, the breakfast room and the dining rooms, but there were so many small glitches during my stay that I cannot understand how this hotel can be five star: Upon arrival I found several strains of long black hair in my wash basin in the bathroom. I had hardly overcome the yucky feeling when I discovered nail clippings on the shelf under the bathroom mirror. Not the welcome I had expected in a hotel that charges a rack rate of more than € 500 for a small room! (I hope that no one actually pays such sums for staying there). My room was small (especially considering the five stars); the TV did not have the many foreign channels that the hotel boasts about - in fact only two in English (BBC News and CNN); The Grand Plaza charges an unbelievable €30 per 25 hours for Wifi in the room; in the reception they had one computer attached to a printer (e.g. if you want to print your boarding card for your return trip), and it is occupied most of the time. It is not OK to keep people hanging around for access to one measly PC when you are a five star hotel. When it was finally my turn to use to computer, the internet-connection was out of order. I waited for a member of stay to come and fix it. When he showed up, he just restarted the computer and walked away without a word. It did not solve the problem, and I had to give up my plan of printing that damn boarding card altogether - having spent more than an hour on nothing. Just not good enough. The noise from the street is overwhelming because of drumming musicians until around 10 pm. Don't expect to be able to sleep during the day if you need a nap or are jetlagged. Get a room as high up as possible. The bed was remarkably hard - or maybe it's just me. A least the sheets were clean. The breakfast is OK, but no gourmet paradise: cereals, the ever-present sweet, dry cakes, sweet croissants, a bit of fruit, etc. The coffee is great. The area is wonderful as is most of Rome. It is very very hard to stay angry or down-hearted in the Eternal City so I shall certainly be back - but not to the Grand Plaza. This hotel is a clear case of bigger not always being better, so if by some miracle you manage to book a double here for € 150 then by all means take it, but if you are faced with a rate higher than that go somewhere else. There are so many nicer hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Worst Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Traveller007_11
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here at 4.30am in the morning being eaten to bits by the mosquitoes at a 510 EURO per night family suite..It is 30 degrees in this room and so annoyed it's not funny. First thing..they missed the pickup at the airport, no apology on arrival, waiting for 10 minutes with kids outside for our bags to be picked up and taken in. No greeting...Dull staff with no personality!! No cot as requested, then another hour wait for this to be sent up to room, after a follow up call another 30 minute wait..oh did I mention the dull staff!! No concierge in this supposed 5 star hotel. Only 5 stars is for the paintings on the roof but I am that annoyed I don't care! Floors creak so the any walking is a threat the kids will wake up...did I mention how dull and unaccomodating the staff are! Minibar is disgraceful..Wifi and internet access within the building is zero...poor explanation of why they cannot get internet in the hotel..Never ever again!!!!!!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers beware”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler60927
Reviews.Content: I realize attitudes toward smokers is different in Europe than in the States but be aware that a room here may mean serious exposure to secondhand smoke. Our room connected to another next door but the doors are not air tight and smoke easily came through to our room making it very unpleasant in our room. The hotel should have nonsmoking portions of the building. It is a beautiful hotel and wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AngelFamilymv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location in Rome if you want to see the sites. We walked everywhere, but the hotel is closest to the Spanish Steps. The church right outside the front door is stunning so don't miss it. The art work in the lobby is beautiful. The room is very small by US standards - we got one with 2 twin beds and a pullout couch for 4 of us - not ideal, but we don't spend much time in the room in a place like Rome. From the airport, we took a taxi (or shared a taxi van) - 15 euros per person. It was easier than navigating the train system and walking to this hotel. Breakfast was pretty good and we did not eat dinner there. I read many reviews about this hotel and I can tell the people that expect 5 star luxury and those that really are happy to be in Rome. We fit the latter group. I have stayed in many of the world's best hotels and I don't ever expect perfection. This is a very old hotel and the artwork is a huge plus, but the modern, large sized rooms and comforts are lacking. Bottom line, I would come back there again. Location location location is the key - if you like shopping, dining and walking to some of the world's most amazing historical sites, you will love this place because they is right out your door.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: m0ntenegr0
Reviews.Content: I'm regular customer of this great hotel, and I have to say that it is a pleasure to be your guest...very friendly staff! Best regards, Danijela

Reviews.Title: “ok but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: kadim
Reviews.Content: I stayed in grand hotel plaza for 3 night,it is convenient hotel,my room was superior not bad. it is true the hotel need some upgrading but it is ok for the price. breakfast was ok. the hotelin the heart of the shopping and tourist area,and lots of restaurant nearby to chose from offering great italian food. all the staff are very helpful and nice specialy NADIR in the front desk he is the best

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Business Hotel - with traditional Italian Touch!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon191278
Reviews.Content: We have run several meetings at the Hotel Grand Plaza. They have all been hugely successful. The support from the conference staff is superb. Nothing is too much trouble. The catering is first class from hot buffet lunches to delicious fantastic gala dinners. Roof top terrace fantastic for cocktail parties! Paola Licciardello is fantastic to work with! Sharon Poole Director Athena Meetings

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious serious repairs. Not a 5-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: misstamimichelle
Reviews.Content: This is certainly not a 5 star hotel. I'll post some brief pros & cons.. Pro: Location to the Spanish Steps is wonderful! You are within walking distance to so many great places! Cons: Where to start? The hotel lost our reservation, saying we booked it via an old website.. which doesn't make sense. When you see the hotel you do get a sense of how grand it is, but you also get an immediate sense of how much work needs done. The carpets are filthy, torn and need replaced. I don't even have words for what type of repairs need to be made to the walls, ceilings, & floors. I understand that for an older hotel you must overlook slight cosmetic flaws, but this was in the least way slight. The room never got cool enough, we finally called on our 2nd day to see if they could send a repair person out to check the machine. When we returned from our day of sightseeing we came back to find that someone had smoked cigarettes in our room. We are all non-smokers so we could tell immediately. The front desk had us moved to another room.. our bags all smelt of cigarettes. Awful Awful! Breakfast was ok, it was in line with the rest of the places that we stayed in Italy. Be sure to check my pictures of the room interior - they give a great idea of what the rooms of this hotel are like.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: shefalipoddar
Reviews.Content: The best part of this very old hotel is the location. It is very close to most of the attractions, walking distance to most of them. In the heart of the shopping and tourist area. Lots of restaurants nearby to chose from offering great italian food. Large rooms but very old and antiquated. Service is very average. Overall good value for money especially for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “A charming old palace - a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Titigre
Reviews.Content: Yes it is true the hotel is not brand new, and everything is not perfectly fixed, but this is part of Roma's charm. Arriving in the lobby you feel imeedialty the charm of the ancient palace. The rooms are all decorated in different styles. The location is perfect as it is walking distance from all the main touristic attractions. It was for us a real pleasure to come back in the hotel after a full day in Roma, and it was difficult to leave at the end of our stay. We more than for sure go back there next time in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “It's a special place”
Reviews.Author: vacay2vacay
Reviews.Content: Granted it's not the grandest hotel in terms of amenities, but staying here would easily transport you into old time Roman elegance. That you are definitely not at an ordinary place. The lobby area itself is enough to make you feel like you are in a grand ballroom. It's decorated with sumptuous red fabrics, gold cravings, stained glass dome, with huge dripping crystal chandeliers. Breakfast rooms and other smaller rooms throughout the first floor echo the same opulence. Yes, this place needs a lot of work in my opinion. But I think that's part of the charm of a Roman way of life, instead of having it in the hands of some big international hotel company. It's not the five star commonly expected in American standards. So, if you are looking for value for your high room rate, please look else where. We stayed here 2 different times. One night before our cruise and 4 nights after. We came as a large group, booking 6 rooms for 14 people, with some people in triple rooms. The triple rooms were essentially a room with 2 separate bedrooms that could easily accommodate 4 people, and a shared bathroom. My husband & I stayed in a double room. The first stay, my husband & I got a really large room facing via Corso. This room came with a large bathroom with 3 shower heads! It was an awesome room we slept so well. No complaint here! The second stay we got a quiet room facing the courtyard. A smaller room with different format, with a bathroom with bathtub & shower. Not much room for 2 large suitcases, but we managed. Loved their crisp white linens that are so heavenly soft, including the plush towels. My only complaint is the bed. I should say, the old spring mattress sprung me awake every time my husband moved! Location is awesome, just around the corner from the fashionable Via dei Condotti and Spanish Steps. It's easy to just walk around everywhere, which is the great joy of exploring Rome is on foot. The location is also so centralized that it's wonderful to be able to come back for a few hours to refresh yourself before hitting the town again. We didn't need to take a lot of taxi, except when we went to our cooking class in Trastevere and to the Vatican. But from there we usually we ended up walking back to the hotel anyway. Getting taxis is quite easy, if not in front of the hotel, there is a taxi stand just a short walk away on via Tomacelli (where there is a Ferrari store!). The staff are friendly & very helpful in many ways, including recommending great restaurants and other information. The porter recommended us Pizzeria al Leoncino in via del Leoncino 28. Delicious pizzas, no tourists, and no English either! Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DUDETTE33
Reviews.Content: The reason why we picked this hotel, because of its superb location near Spanish Steps. I would come back to this hotel again, even though the rooms are not as superiors as the ones in Ritz Carlton. But their bed sheets are so divinely soft; I slept good every night there. Their amenities are one of a kind, their living room is just spectacular, and we had breakfast in a place where I think it used to be a ballroom because it's just so beautiful. The hotel is in need of renovation, especially the fan, some cracks here and there, no shower curtains in a bath tub, maybe a little paint on the ceiling and windows, need new upholstery for their sofas, and they need to pay attention to details of cleanliness. Other than that, I had a lovely time there. Despite the little complaints, I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ycmistro12
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. It is 150 years old of course it will have signs of aging. If your looking for a great central location along with the feeling that you are staying in beautiful museum. Than this is the place for you. The staff was very helpful and friendly. This was my second stay and after reading the negative reviews I almost stayed away. I am glad I ignored the overly critical post. They are the same people that complained about the bumpy cobblestone streets or the fact that they don't speak english. If you looking to spend 800 euros go stay at the four seasons. We were very happy with our stay and would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance”
Reviews.Author: GYPSIE1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for it all, you won't find it here. But if you are looking for palatial elegance in sublime splendor located in the heart of Rome, you will not be disappointed. When you enter the hotel you step back in time to an era gone by. My only regret is that despite how impressive the hotel strikes you from the full size sculptured marble lion guarding the sweeping staircase to the hand painted frescoes, it could still use an infusion of capital to bring the rest of the package up to par. If you can overlook these obvious shortcomings in accommodations and don't mind waking up in the lap of splendor and regal elegance, this hotel can deliver that ambiance on a silver platter. It is a gem even if it is a little rough on the edges. Don't expect it to be something it is not. Just what it is...a rare slice of extravagant splendor in the heart of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Plaza wants to be more than it is”
Reviews.Author: sunfl0wer2011
Reviews.Content: - Room quite old, beds quite short (I'm 1.70m ... ) - Nice bathroom - Hotel ideal situated - Terrace (nice pictures in the web) no service and the furniture not kept clean - Room too expensive for what it is

Reviews.Title: “5* location, 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazzer6064
Reviews.Content: First impression was of stale air in the lobby and particularly the lift area. Bathrooms very poor, we were in suite with connecting double bedroom. Suite had plastic shower in corner of room which leaked all over the floor. Double bedroom didn't have shower, tiny bath, slow filling cistern, old fashioned plastic hairdryer fixed to wall. Decor of bedroom very tired, air conditioning hardly worked - noisy and ineffective. Shame - as the old fashioned grandeur could be special if it facilities were to be updated. Got the impression the hotel staff really didn't care. Good location, easy to walk everywhere we wanted. Everything charged as extras, even ice bucket cost 5 euros. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A most memorable stay in Rome staying at the lovely Grand Hotel Plaza.”
Reviews.Author: Martina2011186605
Reviews.Content: We have just retured from Rome having stayed 3 wonderful nights at the gorgeous Grand Hotel Plaza. This hotel is very well located and is with easy walking distance of the Coloseum, the Vittorio Emmanuelle, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and is a lovely 15-20 minute stroll from the Vatican. You hardly need to take the Open Top tour bus!. The hotel offered us tranquillity and peace each evening as we returned weary from a day's sightseeing. My family had two rooms, each with a spacious balcony and they each had very large bathrooms. The bedrooms were beautifully decorated. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and the service overall was excellent. The meeting rooms and the dining room where we had breakfast each morning were from another time back in history and have to be seen to be believed. We found a beautiful quiet terrace on the fifth floor, where we would all sunbath to our hearts content - It was so peaceful and had panoramic views over the roof tops of Rome. We would highly recommend this hotel and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old hotel charm, and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingEconomist
Reviews.Content: I found the Grand Hotel Plaza an absolutely charming, convenient hotel, and the rooms were spacious. I stayed in a suite, which had a gorgeous bathroom and a beautiful terrace, on which I could sit and read. It is true, the hotel needs some upgrading, but I did not find the hotel falling apart. It's an old hotel, and it has old rooms. Some people like that (including myself). Some people do not. But I would not be dissauded by some of the reviews, which I think give an unfair impression of the hotel. It is still a beautiful hotel with a gorgeous lobby and pretty rooms. The staff are very helpful and pleasant, and they did their best to ensure that my son and I enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family break Feb 2011 at Grand Hotel Plaza”
Reviews.Author: bluesodium
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonder stay at the Hotel Plaza - 2 adults and 3 children in a wonderful 2 bedroom suite both with outdoor terraces. The hotels public rooms are amazing and our rooms were large, very comfortable and totally quiet. Service was prompt and efficient. The location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel of Rome - Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmHendry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Grand Palace recently and found the experience excellent. Location absolutely superb, walkable to many of what Rome has to see and do. Visually this hotel is classicly very grand, with high ceilings in the public areas and a lounge and restaurant that make you say "wow". Felt like I was in a hotel from a different time (but in a good way). Had a fabulous room overlooking rooftops and directly at The Vatican, making for brilliant sunset. Service much better than alot taht I received in Rome. Would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and smelly”
Reviews.Author: LisaHaugesund Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: Superb location, in the midle og Roma centrum. The smell is anoying, and is spread all along the hotel. Picture og the garden must have been taken several years ago, and the guests are not alloved out on the pattio. The staff are not seviceminded. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: MartininLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January. Superb location which is excellent for short stay. Rooms are getting tired and need renovation. Staff need more training.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, charming and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Srg_Brazil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. The building has a charm and elegance that is hard to find. The staff is attentions. The rooms are very spacious, but the furniture is quite poor. The bathroom is large, marble, comfortable. I think it gives good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: urmegr
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. the lobby and bar/restaurant area is beautiful. you should check it out. it all stops there, so after you check that out, go stay somewhere else. The hotel lobby restroom smelled like urine so bad I couldn't even go in - and wasn't any better any day we where there.. both of the elevators smelled horrible, one was unusable due to it. the room was OK, but very outdated. a mini bar in the closet that wasn't even cold. a blow dryer that was a joke, and no dresser or shelves to speak of. As for the service, there was one woman at the front desk during the day who was nice. the rest - horrible. we asked for a wake up call - they never called us. We asked for an extra blanket - and 4 hours later had to ask again. I have stayed in motel 6 and gotten better service than this. what a joke..... avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance - but with a special charm”
Reviews.Author: MarmoraMan
Reviews.Content: A brilliant location - on Via Del Corso in the heart of Rome. We walked everywhere from here, The Colossuem, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Vatican - everywhere. Only the rain on our last night persuaded us to use a taxi to visit Trastevere instead of walking. The hotel offers good value accommodation - our room was in need of some TLC ( as does much of the hotel to be honest) but was clean, airy and with a huge , comfortable bed. Bed linen and towels were changed daily. Great breakfasts with unlimited coffee, juice, cereals, toasts, muffins, cheese & hams. Air conditioning can be a tad noisy on occasions. The main drawing room and piano bar are beautiful examples of high Edwardian (or perhaps more accurately early 20th century Italian) decor. On a Saturday evening were were sipping a late night digestif in the Piano Bar, after an evening meal near Piazza Navonna, when we were entertained by a singer accompanied by a pianist - it made a charming end to the day. We liked this hotel - it's definitely not a cloned international travelers hotel - all glitz but no heart or soul, it's a genuine one off, individual, quirky and fun.

Reviews.Title: “A Plaza of Atonement”
Reviews.Author: RinORL
Reviews.Content: It all started out wrong when we arrived in Rome and there was no one waiting at the designated location to drive us to the hotel. Tired after the trans-Atlantic flight, I tried to keep my cool but the sequence of events made it challenging especially when I could not call the hotel because of a cell phone issue. Ultimately, a kind person at an airport transportation window called the hotel and handed me her phone. The person I spoke with there said there had been a problem and told me to just wait in the line for a cab. I ended up speaking with a District Manger for the Grand Hotel Plaza who apologized, said he would look into the situation and requested that we ask for him when we got there. He did not disappoint as he told me how sorry they were for the problem and that he had upgraded us to a suite and had a basket of fresh fruit waiting for us upstairs. He sent our bags ahead, gave us a tour of the stately and ornate property including the history, the marble-lion staircase and the fabulous Salon delle Feste ballroom. Along the way he introduced us to the head of each department, telling them that we were his special guests and to be sure that we were treated accordingly. The hotel is on the Via del Corso, which runs from the Piazza de Popolo to Piazza Venezia is a wonderful street, crowded with pedestrians and entertainers and designer shops. Our suite was on the 7th floor with a private terrace off the bedroom that looked north to the Villa Medici and the church of Trinità dei Monti at the top of the Spanish Steps. Shuttered doors from the other two rooms opened to the expansive Lemon Terrace that ran across the entire side of the hotel with potted plants, flowers and seating vignettes from which we had an unobstructed, panoramic view over the rooftops and down into the quaint streets below. From the south, it seemed like we could reach across the street and touch the façade of the domed church across the street. We did not take advantage of the hotel’s offer for special services but we did spend five glorious nights in the comfort and elegance of this historic and well-located hotel for about the same price we had been prepared to pay for any nice hotel room in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home at Grand Hotel Plaza, if you live in luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Anchier
Reviews.Content: Hotel Highlights – (1). The location is fantastic. We walked to coliseum and St. Peters twice (about a 20-30 minute walk). The Spanish steps are just a couple minutes away by walk. And, you’re right in the heart of a busy shopping area. (2). The hotel is like a small palace - the hotel ballroom, the lion and the staircase are all very spectacular and classy. (3). Breakfast Room with beautiful décor, fresco – I felt like I was eating inside a beautiful museum and under marvelous paintings. (4). 5th floor Lemon Terrace – A nice area to relax and look over the rooftops of Rome. Room Highlights - --- Our very nice and spacious executive suite had two large, lovely rooms, a nice bathroom, foyer, separate dressing area (with a floor-to-ceiling mirror) a balcony facing the inside court yard. --- There was a big gazebo was right next to our balcony. I spent quite a lot of time at the balcony after our sight seeing. It was perfect for relaxing or reading with some wine or snacks. The courtyard was a very pretty area full of lemon trees. --- The bed was extremely comfortable. They’ll put a bed board under the mattress if you prefer firmer support. I wish I could take their bed home. --- The bed linens, bath towels, and robes were all very clean and of a very high quality. The Grand Hotel Plaza truly earned its five stars. Minor Issues --- The front desk staff was very busy at all times, meaning you might have to wait a little bit to get an answer to a question or to make a request. --- Internet service was sporadic on weekends. They told us this was normal, because of high device traffic in the area (people on the busy streets carrying their I-phones and smart phones). If you NEED internet service because you’re doing some work on your trip, this can cause problems. The front desk did have a backup plan for us in case service was completely unavailable. We were finally able to get online late in the evening. --- There were no English language newspapers available in the hotel, but they were able to direct us to where we could find one. All in all, worth splurging for a five-star experience on a very special occasion. A great way to conveniently experience so much of what Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Appauling for 5 *”
Reviews.Author: DublinHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: What a hugh disappointment, this hotel boasts being 150 years old and I really believe it has not been updated in the Last 150 years. We made the massive mistake of the prepayment of the room, double room so grotty and dated complained and we were moved to a slightly better room but still not 5 star quality. The dust in the place is brutal, we spent the duratin of our stay sneezing and neither of us asthma suffers if you are you would die here! Avoid at your pearl!

Reviews.Title: “Poor -- how can this hotel be listed as 5 star?”
Reviews.Author: DARH72
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed. Air of charming but dilapidated grandeur was swiftly dissipated by room not ready at 6 30 pm and being a twin rather than double as requested. After complaining, we were then upgraded to a better double room. Overall room quality is faded at best -- needs re-painting; plugs in room didn't work etc. No wifi. We chose the hotel on the basis that it was 5 star and centrally located. Well...the location is great but the hotel is nowhere close to 5 star...and it's expensive...It's a shame -- the hotel has many beautiful features (e.g. grand ballroom) but is in need of extensive refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! I will absolutely stay at this hotel whenever I am in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Biz_Travels
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine a better location -- or better value -- in Rome than the Grand Hotel Plaza. It was the heart of the city and walkable to everything. The rooms have wonderful character and the staff was incredibly responsive (even with a series of questions and requests my colleagues and I had). It was truly an outstanding experience and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: afmp
Reviews.Content: The room was hot. The air conditioner was not on when we arrived. The hair dryer did not work. The internet was totally impossible and no technical support for using our computer.The telephone was not plugged in, There was no concierge and the staff was too busy and unfriendly. One night there was NO hot water.They mentioned airport transfer support,but they did not answer our emails. The lights in the rooms were about 25 watts and it was very dark. The breakfast was large but not tasty. I would never stay at this hotel again even though the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Neber die spanische Treppe, Luxus”
Reviews.Author: SWH2010
Reviews.Content: Superbly located hotel near the Spanish stairs. Next door to Rome's luxurious shopping street (Via dei condotti). The hotel has an air of luxury with a great entrance hall and staircase. The rooms are well kept and quiet. Good internet connection (for a fee). Great array of pay for a fee movies. Excellent breakfast facilities. If your wish is to be centrally located in style, this is a great hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: banuIstanbul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel with my friends and words are not enough to tell how special it was. All the staff was doing their best to please their guests, great hospitaility, friendly, helpful. The building itself is like a museum! Spectacular!!This is our 3rd time of staying and surely there will be many more times. Sinan-Banu

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: rometraveller9876543
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome - stayed at this hotel last Thursday 12th August. The good first - unbeatable location. Amazing public rooms but to enjoy spending 18 euros at the bar on a beer, tomato juice and a diet coke is a joke. Hence why we were on our own. The bad: Grumpy check in staff Arrived after a cruise with lots of luggage - no attempt to help us in with it Room not ready so we asked for our luggage to be locked up - when we returned 3 hours later it was still in the lobby - luckily iPad etc all still in place Air conditioning noisy and ineffectual Bed - must have been 75 years old - uncomfortable and sloping on both sides Sofa bed - my 10 year old son said he could feel the bars through and the floor would have been more comfortable Bathroom - poor shower and not overly clean Wi Fi - meant to be free but very dodgy service, more often than not it logged us on to a public Wi Fi that required payment For 257 euro you can do much better !!

Reviews.Title: “Always HAD rave reviews but now....will NEVER return”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelClearwater
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel over the years since 1999. We have referred many friends and co-workers and have enjoyed our stay over the years. Our room has been upgraded each year and it has been lovely. Breakfast was always a full breakfast and the presentation was wonderful.....UNTIL this past March. The room we usually stay in was not kept up. We could not sit on the furniture on the terrace because the cushions were all in shreds and filthy. The awning was hanging in strips. We would have to go down to the front desk to ask for the maid to come to the room since no one had come by 3:00 in the afternoon and even after they "cleaned", we would still have to go down to ask for clean glasses and toilet paper as we were left with none. Breakfast had been reduced where they didn't even have the standard Italian breakfast with cold cuts. Although I don't eat meat, our guests that stayed in another room under our recommendations, do eat meat and we found we had to get breakfast elsewhere so they could eat a proper Italian breakfast. When I emailed my hotel contact to let them know of my disappointment in how things have changed, asking if they were getting ready to close etc, they said they were sorry to hear that and to make sure I contacted the manager to make future bookings. I had no problem with that as I understand, things happen and with all the years of having a wonderful time, I still intended to return. When I contacted them as instructed to make reservations for next year - it was suggested I go to a different hotel because I had complained for the first time ever!!!! I have stayed all over the world and this has never happened. You would think that people would strive to improve based on feedback rather than refuse you a room. All I can say is, if you want to stay here, good luck...never, never ask for anything or offer a suggestion or complaint because they will refuse you a room. Not to mention, the staff is beyond rude and arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Mhabz83
Reviews.Content: Ok....I literally checked into the hotel for one hour and checked out...I had read the reviews but was convinced by a friend that "it can't be that bad!!!" when i walked into the room, I wanted to jump out the window,but the window didn't open....the was mould over the air-conditioning unit, some panels were missing from the wall, the shower head had mould on it...I took a few looks, sat on the worn out couch...left my bags there for half an hour and took a cab to the boscolo exedra....there is absolutely no way I would have stayed there any longer...if I wanted a 2 star hotel, I would have booked in one and not been charged 300 euro per night....in fact, if you payed me i wouldn't stay there.... If i could upload the pics of the mould I would but they r currently on my cell phone....in short, stay clear!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Typical European Attitudes”
Reviews.Author: msehackett
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Europe for 5 years, I am sorry to say this hotel is typical - they simply have no desire to please their guests. They have so many people coming and going, why should they care? Too bad. The hotel is out-dated, staff unhelpful and sometimes rude. Management takes most of the responsibility for this, I think. If you stay here quite frankly you are just wasting money. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Just a pity”
Reviews.Author: ismaithliom
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend stay at the plaza and having read the reviews before i left i was a little apprehensive.This is not a five star and anybody booking it under five stars will be dissapointed,it does not have all the extras that a modern five star has,its about 31/2 maybe a 4 star.It's location without question is fantastic. I found the front desk staff very courteous and when asked a question they helped you in everyway,however you must ask or they will not go out of their way to inform you of anything. The hotel itself is very old world grand and it is a shame that its not used to its full potential,i have never stayed in a hotel that was so dead in atmosphere,maybe if they lowered the bar prices and encouraged the guests to eat and drink (at reasonable prices) the place might get some life in it. The bedrooms were spacious and clean ,i can see why people give out about the decor and furniture and it goes back to the 5 star rating the fixtures are old but in a strange way fit the hotel. All in all we found the hotel very good but all we did was sleep in it and thats all i think they encourage you to do which again is a big shame for such a grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel; Overpriced; Staff Doesn't Care.”
Reviews.Author: outpaddling
Reviews.Content: It's certainly not what we expected from the hotels own description and implied by the high price. Our travel agent booked this for My wife and I and we stayed two nights in May 2010, until we could find an alternate hotel for the following four nights. We paid 246.50 Euros per night for a "classic" room plus Internet access at 15 Euros per day extra. There was no bellman to meet taxis. The doors having a ramp for rolling bags are locked. The only open door is a revolving door up one step and we struggle to check in. Our reservation cannot be found because they reversed my first and last name. The elevator smells of mold and mildew. Hallways are undecorated and institutional, with an old solid-red carpet and dingy paint. The room is large enough but has not been maintained for many years, i.e. needs paint, new furniture, new fixtures. No note paper, no pen, no chair for the desk, dim lighting not bright enough for reading or working. No rod in wardrobe to hang clothes except the flimsy attached hangars. No individual hand soap; must use a bottle of reusable hand soap. Bathroom smells of sewer gas. Shower is a cheap plastic unit, too small and in great contrast to the marble walls and floors. Shower drain is not clogged but still fills with water up to the ankles (yuck!). Sink stopper does not work. Not enough light in bathroom for shaving or makeup. No stands for luggage. Windows are shuttered and for good reason. No view except into other rooms. No facial tissue is provided or even available. We must call housekeeping because there is no toilet paper, no shampoo, refills, etc. Room safe is so high that we can't even reach it. No umbrellas for guests when it rained and we sorely needed one. We wait for the for rain to stop and have a drink in the lobby. Big mistake! We are charged 30 euros for 2 drinks (17 for a shot of scotch and 13 for a shot of grappa). Outrageous price, more than 2 bottles would cost! Amazing old ballroom between lobby and bar but it is empty and cold as the grave. The Continental Breakfast is a joke and don't believe what the management has said in their reply posted to these reviews. I observed a guest asking for eggs but not being told that the a' la carte menu is at significant extra cost. Eggs are approx 10 Euros extra. Anyone giving this hotel a positive review has no real experience with 5-Star properties. It's a mystery why this hotel continues to stay in business, let alone maintain their stars. It is a shame because the location is perfect and the public areas were once grand.

Reviews.Title: “Old and ugly rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elliette
Reviews.Content: I feel like a fool paying such money for such an ugly room. the manager dit not care at all, enough tourists he said! to our complaint. i would like to tell everyone.....do not stay at his hotel, it has lost its glory long a go!! spend your money on nicer things!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as they think they are”
Reviews.Author: Andyhuber
Reviews.Content: The web sight make this hotel look fab with the likes of George Clooney and Winston Chirchill having stayed there. Bet that was a very long time ago. The first room 214 they gave us had curtains hanging down and the standard lamp which was the main light in the room didn't work. The shower hose was not attached to the shower head and when they fixed it the water would not come out of the shower head. We did eventually get it fixed. When we went to bed we found the window didn't close and we were on the main road so we didn't get any sleep. We were mover to an other room which was a bit quieter but there was no plug in the sink or the bidet and the shower holder had been taken off the wall and not replaced. When we went to bed we found out the toilet ran with water all the time so not such a peacful night. Vastly over priced and the staff were rather rude. They said they had there own ca to pick us up and it would be 60 Euros to bring us from the Airport and they added 10% to everything it was only 40 Euros to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the negative reviews here on this site - This hotel was LOVELY!!”
Reviews.Author: mrgelli
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe so many of you do not like this hotel!!!! What is wrong with you lot!!!???? I have just got back from my lovely stay in this hotel (23rd - 27th April 2010) and can honestly say that it was a pleasure staying at the Grand Plaza. What do you lot expect?? Butler service?? every spec of dust to disappear everyday? Your here to see the 'Eternal City' not to inspect the grains of dust that might appear in doorways. Your mostly paying for the 'great location' - The Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps are both closeby as is the Colosseum (a nice walk recommended to take in the sights along the way instead of using buses or taxis). The staff were really nice to me, and not just the cleaners either! I asked the reception desk to telephone a shop for me (Profondo Rosso - Dario Argento Horror shop) located not far from St.Peters to find out if it was open - this was done straight away and the reception desk suggested that I could take a walk and provided me with a map instead of using buses - basically if you use transport you will miss every detail this city has to offer. My trip was so memorable! and I will come back to Rome and this hotel AGAIN!!!!! Apart from seeing some of the city including St.Peters and the Vatican museums I also attended a superb football game at the Stadio Olimpico 'AS Roma v Sampdoria' - unfortunately my team AS Roma lost 2-1 but sitting with 55,000 die-hard Roma fans was truly mind blowing. Also, if this hotel was updated 'modernised' i.e. "glass building" like a modern London business firm then the character will be lost forever. Of course this hotel is expensive! It's bang in the centre of Rome : ) I dined one evening inside the hotel and believe you me - you get what you pay for: The 2 course meal was expensive but it was worth every single euro The 5 star status of hotel lived up to its bill - and I mean the quality of food. And to the person that ordered a pot of tea? in room @18 euros try that in other 5 star hotels in London or other European cities - it's the same everywhere To the 'Grand Hotel Plaza' - I will be back soon! : ) Forza Roma Forever

Reviews.Title: “Great location !!!,was once Grand,but now lacks personality -staff unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: oscarsdelight
Reviews.Content: Although my husband booked this as a surprise trip for a wedding anniversary,last year, i suppose the fact that im only getting round to writing anything - says a lot !.Having never been in Rome/Italy before - and not knowing what to expect...i now feel that i can contribute some information to somebody seeking answers about whether to stay at this hotel- or not.On the positive side , it is absolutely in a fantastic location for a lot of shopping, site seeing , public transport etc.....and the Hotel reminds me of a building that has been indeed very grand ! BUT - it lacks sole , its dead, its staff are totally in a world of their own - in fact , i felt unwanted as not ONCE during our stay -did anyone speak to me ....in fact i felt robbed!...just take my money and run !!- in fact it was ridiculously expensive almost 20euro for a diet coke..needless to say - the bar was always empty...it must be a very lonely job ....but then if the hotel had a personality implant - it might help...so would i recommend a stay there - NO....find somewhere else were you will feel appreciated.As for Rome - glad i went, very historic city and lovely architecture, shops to die for , and very expensive....glad i went but this Hotel would need a lesson from the likes of Hotels in Dubai where you are made to feel so special and CRAVING to go back there ....So my advice would be - try Rome if you want...but be prepared to feel robbed as you dont get much of anything for your money - where as Dubai -its like a MAGNET.....a wonderful, historic modern clean city , with the advantage of sheer luxury hotels and staff who are pleased beyond belief that you go there...beaches to die for and VERY multicultural and choice beyond belief of places to see, eat , shop, so my advice - ditch Rome - Go Dubai-YOU will not regret it ....they could learn the Romans a thing or two !

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury - DEFINITELY NOT!”
Reviews.Author: mchlcrw
Reviews.Content: 5 star luxury is typically reserved for hotels that excel at all levels of service. It is reserved for few hotels. This hotel was no doubt a fine hotel in earlier times, however, it is now a run down, old hotel, in desperate need of massive quantities of money to make it once again a luxury property. At this point in time, its location is definitely its only 5 star attribute. From a less than friendly reception staff, to messy public spaces, to dark hallways, to nasty , crumbling bathrooms, to no bathroom towels, to no attention to any detail, I did not enjoy this hotel at all. The hotels for my other two weeks in Italy were all 5 star luxury properties for which I had no complaints at all. The responsible parties for rating hotels should definitely revisit this property, and my guess would be a three star rating, at best.

Reviews.Title: “Rude & Arrogant Staff, Shabby Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandSFluffy
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Rome and had unfortunately booked to stay at this hotel. Although it claims to be a 5 star, in reality this hotel should be rated as a 2 star. The reception staff are astoundingly rude & arrogant. They completely ignored us everytime we passed by reception (no smiles or greeting whatsoever) and were very unhelpful if we asked anything. Breakfast was an utter joke and we could hardly find anything to eat unless you wanted to fill yourself with cakes first thing in the morning (as 95% of the buffet comprised of the same cakes being served every morning), no fresh fruit, no toast. The hotel lobby / ballroom reflects its past glory and looks quite grand (though bit shabby) but we felt this was a hotel on its last legs. The staff don't really care and especially the reception staff make the customer feel most unwanted. We certainly wish to return to Rome but will never stay at this hotel again and would never, ever recommend it to anyone. Highly avoidable. We travel quite frequently and this is the worst hotel we have ever stayed at !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff from hell”
Reviews.Author: bettypink
Reviews.Content: Just don't stay here, the staff are rude and ignorant and are not customer friendly. They need to be sent to Ireland to learn how to treat their customers. €18 for small pot of tea in bedroom. They made my stay like one from hell they were so nasty and rude, horrible actually. We will never stay here again and we will be telling all our friends to stay at the Crown Plaza instead. The food was very limited, it should only be a two star hotel. The staff all need to be sacked. One day, I actually saw one of the staff in the restaurant verbally abusing a customer. The worst hotel ever in my life and I am in my sixties and have travelled far.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ive ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sasa_10
Reviews.Content: awfull from start to finish, have staying in rome several times in several different hotels and this is definately the worst ive had the unfortunate experience of staying in. staff very unfriendly and unhelpfull, woke one moring to no water, either hot or cold, breakfast limited, no fresh fruit, no museli! toilet paper not repaced in hotel room and poor cleaning job. roof terrace closed every night of our stay. Its a shame this hotel is so poorly run because its in a great location and is a beautifull old building.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to be treated like you are invisible go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMJCork
Reviews.Content: We decidied to stay for our honeymoon at this hotel. We have never been made to feel welcome from the onset. It was as if we were invisible. None of the front line staff greeted us or spoke to us only to dismiss us with disregard. It was a terrible experience and we will never return to rome because of the way we were treated. The only staff that were friendly were the cleaning staff . It has been a nightmare for us not because the hotel is of poor standard, it is a good hotel only for the staff and how they treat who are supposed to be their customers. In a recession you would expect more hospitality considering what we were spending to stay at the hotel. It was without a doubt the worst hotel experience we have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: nellyireland09
Reviews.Content: Staff very unfriendly & cold in manner. It was our honeymoon and unfortunately, it was a very bad choice by us. We told staff that it was a big occasion for us but apart from a begrudging Congratulations.. thats about as far as the enthusiasm went. The Web is amazing & this is what attracted me.. What a let down !!! Hotel itself is stunning inside - like a palace but the staff let the beautiful historic hotel down. The only pleasant staff we met was Alessi the Hotel Porter. The location was central . The Breakfast was very poor - packet toast/3 measly cereals - very much 2Star qualify. Hotel does not justify 5star.. No way !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J01970
Reviews.Content: I will probably echo most of the negative views already against this hotel, so I won't labour the point too much. However, it has to be noted that this is a pretty awful hotel and my husband and I had an unpleasant experience from start to finish and definitly not what we would have expect from a 5 star hotel. First impression of the reception areas was of a very grand, oppulent hotel, but on closer inspection the decor was tired and dirty. Check in was ok, but we were told that we would need to wait 30 mins for our luggage to be taken to our room. Please don't get me wrong, I am happy to carry my own luggage which we did, but we were paying for a 5* service. On our way to our deluxe room, my olfactory senses were abused by a terrible aroma which permiated all through the public areas for the duration of our stay. The room was very very small, even for Rome standards, Included in our deal - was free mini bar and breakfast. The minibar had 3 bottles of water and a tonic for us to choose from, it was not replensished on a daily basis, in fact the glasses weren't even cleaned on a daily basis. Breakfast was ok, cakes and coffee, although there was an al a carte menu, which seemed pretty reasonable. Reception staff were unhelpful and one in particular was down right rude. However, I will end the review on a positive note and that is the hotel location, shopping galore and a short walk from many of the must see sights.

Reviews.Title: “Days of Glory gone by”
Reviews.Author: SimanaMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment! I thought I was heading for luxury and comfort at a 5 star and ended up feeling like we were in a 3 star hotel. the lobby was dreary, marble and signs were not cleaned, the staff was cool and unfriendly, no meat or fruit at breakfast, no robes even when asked twice, no tissues, no floor clothes laid beside bed (typical in Italy and at the other 4 hotels (all 4 star) we stayed at), no turn down service, no magnifying mirror, no replenishment of toiletries (and the ones they had smelled old) dreary, dreary, need I say more? Oh, and wobbly brass bed frame with taped legs?

Reviews.Title: “tired, old hotel with one of the best location”
Reviews.Author: jump3r
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights. Everything looks old and tired. One of the girl at the reception was quite rude too. They have lots of different type of rooms. Our room was kinda noisyt oo in the morning. We could hear the sound of people walking on the room above ours. In the morning, there were lots of sounds from outside too. The size of the room was okay. Quite clean too. The bed was okay. The location of the hotel is the best. It s literally next to all the shopping areas. Very close to spanish steps, piazza novona, trevi fountain, etc...And the price of the hotel is very reasonable compared to other hotels. Would i stay here again? Maybe, if other hotels are either full or asking for ridiculous price. The only thing i like about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay .nice hospitality from staff.nice rooms.location the best”
Reviews.Author: zybern
Reviews.Content: best location for shopping & dining.nice rooms.with all facilitiesin.quick response from staff.good value for money

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular kick-off to our Italian honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: daniellemarie116
Reviews.Content: My husband had the most wonderful stay at this amazing hotel. It is the epitome of Italian luxury, and from the moment we walked into the hotel to the moment we checked out, we felt like we were in a dream. The lobby is lush, opulent, like a piece of historical Italian architecture, sculpted lions greet you at the foot of the staircase, the bar room is rich with velvets and mahogany and an amazing selection, and the staff makes you feel like a celebrity. The hotel is well located among shopping, near the Spanish steps, surrounded by amazing restaurants. The room itself was the best hotel room we've ever been in -- beautiful and serene, but roomy and airy (even the bathroom was incredible), and we were lucky enough to have a terrace that overlooked the best of Rome. I can't recommend this hotel strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel a Good Value But Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: David_Blosangeles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Grand Plaza is a good choice if you want a nice big hotel room in the center of town at a good price, and you like old world charm. The hotel has some amazing attributes – the public rooms are fabulously decorated with frescoes, beautiful woodwork from the last century, and a huge marble staircase going up 5 floors. We got a room one level up from “basic” and it was huge, with a separate dressing area, probably about 700 sq feet in all for E250 including taxes and continental breakfast. Also, plenty of great details including a nice 19th century desk with hidden drawers, great moldings, even a post designed as a roman column. Marble bathroom and fabulous old doors. Our air conditioning was great (but I would stay on a lower floor in the summer) and we had a room overlooking the main street with a great view of the church across the street. There is no regular traffic on the street, and the soundproof windows worked very well. On the downside, the hotel is a bit ragged around the edges. Now we are very picky travelers (I really wanted to stay at the Eden, but at E450 and up a night a bit pricy) so in general the room was fine. However, there was some worn woodwork, slight stains on the damask walls (but really high quality damask it was!). However, you cant beat the 12 foot ceiling, with beautiful appliqué. The tub had been painted and a bit was peeling a bit, that sort of thing. Also, the service was not good. The staff was not particularly nice (one woman was a real witch) and there were odd things like a tray of someone’s room service left out for the better part of a day. However room cleaning staff was very good and bed excellent, sheets clean, everything we needed was there. We stayed a week and had a great time. Compared to many of the other hotels in the area (other than Eden, Hassler, Flora, etc) Plaza for us the best of the bunch because of the size of the spaces. We do not like claustrophobic places, which most are in Rome. A much better bet than many of the "boutique" hotlels we looked at for the same price with much smaller rooms and no real public spaces to speak of.
