There is a also a nice rooftop bar with a view of the spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and old the glory days of this establishment have long gone.”
Reviews.Author: aircombustion
Reviews.Content: I usually do not write reviews i beleive that expectations vary amongst individuals. But one thing that is a constant is that this hotel is way past its prime. The place is run down and gloomy . Old is O.K if kept up well, but this place is anything but. Our room was digy and smelled like mold. The bathroom had an odor far worse , that of of sewage. The door handle was falling of the door and parquet tiles uplifting from the floor. The staff was kurt and did the absolute minium. They were not unpolite but neither were they friendly or helpful. The only positive thing I could say is that the bed linen was excellent, clean and fresh. I do not enjoy giving any establishment a bad rating but i feel compelled to warn other travellers NOT TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL. .

Reviews.Title: “The Convenient Place To Stay For Shoppers...”
Reviews.Author: Sagitarrius
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome for Easter last April with our younger daughter who is 7 years old. We were immediately met in the airport and was brought to the hotel. We were pleased with the location because it is conveniently located. It is very close to the shopping areas, restaurants, Fountain of the Trevi and the Spanish Steps. The room we got was clean and spacious. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel and I recommend this to people who do not like to walk too far since this is place is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Twickerpedia
Reviews.Content: We had a truly enjoyable stay at the Plaza during February. The staff were extremely helpful and attentive and made us feel very welcome. They gave us directions to places we wanted to visit, assisted us with a computer link and one of the barmen gave us a lesson on the Italian names for different types of glasses. The grandeur of the main salon is quite magnificent and we like to think that a little of the hotel’s glamour rubbed off on us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Plaza, Romes Best Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dougbutabi
Reviews.Content: My wife, young daughter and myself stayed in the Grand Hotel Plaza during our stay in Rome in Jan 09. We searched extensively prior to travelling over and we booked the Grand Hotel Plaza as we felt it would be the best for our stay. On arrival at the airport, the hotel had arranged a car to collect us and bring us to the hotel which was great! When we arrived outside the hotel we couldnt believe how Grand it looked and how central we were in Rome! We were greeted with very friendly staff who couldnt have been more helpful! We stayed in one of the suites with a terrace facing the front of the hotel. The suite was better than we could have hoped for, and the view from the terrace was fantastic! As we travelled with our 6 month old daughter, we needed a cot, which was already in our room upon arrival, and already made up with clean bedding which my wife was more than happy with! Within the hotel the service was first class. Right from reception, breakfast, porters, bar staff etc! everyone was so helpful. a special mention to the bar staff as they were great company during my nights in the hotel bar!! the reception staff were great in providing us with directions, ideas on where to go, booking taxis, and general enquiries. The hotel itself is i feel in the best location for any hotel in Rome. Each land mark, city sight, bars, shops etc are all located it seems right around the hotel. My wife especially enjoyed the fact that the boutique shops are right around the corner, although my wallet didnt!! all in all i would recommend this hotel to everyone travelling to Rome, whether you are single, young couple, family or other. this hotel caters for all types and their service is one of the best i have witnessed and i would be a frequent traveller. needless to say we will be staying again very soon at the Grand Hotel Plaza!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: anaporto09
Reviews.Content: Felt like being in a museum. Rooms very large and "grand", fits Rome very well. Could walk to all the main attractions, shopping was right next to us. Staff was very kind and helpfull, typical Italian. They got us a guide and sent us to very good restaurants. It's not the place to be at if you're into modern places but if that isn't the case just give it a try:) P.s The view from the Terraces has it all!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Janettravel
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Grand Hotel Plaza was a unique experience. A unique hotel in a wonderful position exactly at the centre of the shopping district and we could visit all main sites by foot. The atmospere of the hotel brought us back to last century and let us feel really in Rome... not in a hotel that could be everywhere in the world. Staff was very kind and with nice attitude. Rooms are quite spacious and richly decorated, with bright windows and marble bathroom. Really a good experience and I would reccommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: Travebug
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel based on the Hotels website - the photos are better than the reality. Foyer - ripped wall paper, tired furniture, bored staff. Bedroom - much larger than other hotels we have stayed at in Rome on previous visits, comfy bed, large bathroom. Plasma TV, large, which we did not expect! Breakfast - lots of cakes and coffee, but anything savoury not included in the price, despite our voucher saying "Full breakfast Included" . Location - close to all main attractions, as in a 10 minute walk to Trevi fountain, 5 mins walk to the Spanish Steps, and lots of great restaurants and shopping right outside the door. I loved the staircase, and the ballroom, but overall i have to say it is an overpriced Hotel, otherwiuse i would recommend it for the size of the rooms, and the overall ambience. Would love to have seen it in its hayday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Day”
Reviews.Author: lafayette20
Reviews.Content: The Plaza gets some bad reviews, but for us, it was amazing. The staff had never staged a wedding on their own before but when we contacted them they were excited at the opportunity. Extremely gracious and helpful, they did everything to make the day memorable. The staff was excellent...even loaning us money to go take pictures as we did not have our wallets on us after the ceremony.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, bad service, high price!”
Reviews.Author: Adamoeeva
Reviews.Content: Came to Rome with a bunch of colleagues from all over the world. The foyer is stunning and the room for breakfast would take your breath away. Rooms are small, but neat. However, many face other buildings or the street: collegues complained that it was extremely noisy and had to change their room. I recommend rooms facing the courtyard. Biggest downside: service was very bad. Internet was non functioning for more than 48 hours and reception was totally unhelpful (quite rude too!). There is not fitness club, which is also pretty bad. Finally, the price was way too high, despite the great central location and the spectacular ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “charming patina in an exceptional location”
Reviews.Author: snowpine
Reviews.Content: Before visiting in Aug/09 I was concerned by the previous negative reviews and contacted the Grand Plaza about my apprehensions. I am happy to report that the hotel took very good care of us. All of the staff we came in contact with were amiable & helpful. Our two bedroom suite with balcony was very nice, although our outdoor furniture needed re-upholstering. Large portions of the hotel were undergoing renovation but that didn't interfere with our stay. Although a more complete refurbishment would be ideal by my standards, I must say that the Grand Plaza has a charming patina that is entirely in keeping with the rest of Rome. The location is absolutely superb.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TheRelaxationClinic
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me a weekend in Rome for Christmas, and I was really looking forward to staying in what was described in the brochure as a 5 star superior hotel. We checked in with unfriendly staff who couldn't find our booking. When they finally got it together we were given our room key and had to get on with it - no being shown to our room or having our bags taken up as you'd expect with a 5 star hotel. The lounge is huge and amazing, with gigantic chandeliers and painted ceilings. However our room was small, although we think this is part of the charm of an older hotel! There was no air conditioning - it's only turned on in the summer . There was no shower curtain or panel so it was impossible to shower in the traditional way without flooding the entire bathroom, and there was no movie channel as it was broken. We had to request a second bathrobe as only one was provided. On the upside, it was very quiet; our room looked on to the inner courtyard. We wandered around the hotel like ghosts, being ignored by staff, it was one of the strangest hotel experiences we've ever had! The barman was the only staff member who was friendly. The continental breakfast was adequate but there was no bread, ham or fresh fruit and it relied heavily on sweet pastries. The coffee, thank goodness, was fantastic. Hot food was very expensive. This hotel is big on faded grandeur and clearly gets away with a huge amount because of its location; it's ideally situated in the centre of the best shopping, near to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. You can't fault the location but we'll look for a different hotel for our next stay in Rome because this place is ridiculously overpriced. We went to two excellent restaurants near the Trevi Fountain; Il Chianti and another just around the corner - the food was heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Clean, average service but book a discount deal”
Reviews.Author: graham11
Reviews.Content: I decided to write in view of some of the indifferent reviews I read about the hotel before I travelled. I booked two conjoined rooms on the top floor which looked inwards over the courtyard. The checking in process was easy and both rooms were very clean and newly decorated. The beds comfortable and we all slept well. Both rooms were very quiet especially for Rome. I suspect the rooms overlooking the street may have been noisier but the largely pedestrian street was surprisingly quiet after midnight. The location could not be bettered as it was central to all the major attractions which could easily be reached on foot. There were three taxi ranks within a few metres of the hotel if needed. The buffet breakfasts were ample and a cooked breakfast was available at (a significant) extra charge. surprisingly there was no a restaurant in the hotel although there were plenty within walking distance. We did find the dining experience in the Rome restaurants disappointing but we do have high expectations.The hotel is a little faded and the command of the English language of the staff was imperfect. I suspect if you require a concierge service (as one expects in five star hotels) you may be disappointed and the rooms may get very hot in the summer. There is supposed to be air conditioning in the rooms but this was not in use when we went in March (not needed ? turned off) and there are only three fan speeds (one of which failed to work). I suspect on hot days the cooling may be inadequate. Overall, I would recommend the hotel with the above provisos. I booked via the internet and obtained a good discount by paying in advance and booking relatively late and booking at a less popular time of year. Who wants to visit Rome by choice in the high summer anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SheilaWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! The web site displays pictures of a beautiful, opulent ,luxury hotel which raised my expectations, only to have them dashed as soon as we walked into the main lobby. What greeted us was indeed a Grand opulent old building, but this one was well past its best days. It soon became obvious that a grand project of refurbishment was underway, but to be fair the hotel should have been closed while this worek was carried out. Upstairs there was a thick layer of plaster dust lying on every surface and in various places builders tools had been left lying around. We waited almost two hours for someone from maintainence to come and repair our room safe; food ordered from room service was quick but cold; staff on the check-in desk just couldn't be bothered and were not especially friendly or helpful. Emptying the bath resulted in water oozing up through the bathroom floor, but it took half a day before someone came to sort the problem. We had originally booked in for a four night stay but decided to check out after one night and one day. The location was superb for seeing the best bits of Rome, but sadly that's all this hotel had going for it.

Reviews.Title: “A palace in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GYPSIE1
Reviews.Content: A beautiful renaissance palace in a wonderful location on the via de Corso just walking distance from everything from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain to the Campo di Fiori and the Coliseum. It is an old hotel and needs a little sprucing up but the ambiance and exquisite frescoes and period furniture more than make up for the discrepancies. The personnel at the front desk were personable and professional and they try very hard to please. Breakfast was good though without any hot dishes. The usual choices. All in all an enjoyable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Plaza, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Leeelizabeth
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Plaza is a hotel with history. it looks tired today though. crowd is older. breakfast is very simple and basic. room is clean. service is prompt and friendly. and the location!! can not beat. its close to all major attraction and right in the vinicity of Spanish Steps. i will recommend it to my friend. one thing: when you plan your trip with a tour guide through the hotel make sure everyone is clear with price per hour and now many hours. otherwise, you maybe unpleasantly surprised like what happened to us. Lee from New York City. end of November 2008

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leeb11
Reviews.Content: This must be the worst 5 star hotel to gain the rating. I booked over the phone directly to the hotel. The girl was very nice and said it was buffet breakfast included, but it wasn't the manager was not available to discuss the situation. That wasn't the only problem, the hotel was dirty and grubby, the desk staff were unhelpful, The hairdryer in the room broken, the chair in the room broken, The glass shelf in the bathroom coming off the wall. All in all certainly not a five star experience, I did send a lemail complaining but surprise surprise no response. The only positive about this hotel was the location! Give me a Starwood Sheraton anytime

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay In Summer”
Reviews.Author: saramillbrae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2007 when the weather was in the '90's (hot!). The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous and they have great breakfast every morning. The rooms are fairly big and the bathrooms are really nice. The location is so great which is what we were going for. However, the air conditioning barely worked. We had the A/C run all day and night and our room was still in the high '70's every day. It was terrible. Also, this hotel was expensive as we thought we were getting a 5 star hotel. However, this hotel is maybe a 3.5 so be careful with hoe much you pay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel-in-Rome
Reviews.Content: 31 Oct 08 This was my 4th visit to The Grand Plaza on the Via del Corso. I cannot speak highly enough of this wonderful hotel. Great location in centre of Rome, large clean rooms, wonderful dining room and lounge. I wouldnt stay anywhere else but this hotel while in Rome. A. Daniel

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: SunnyinArizona
Reviews.Content: We were planning a trip of a lifetime to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary; only to have it interrupted by my husband having to have emergency stomach surgery. What was supposed to be a one week, fun-filled trip turned into a traveler's worst nightmare. Without the help of the staff at the Grand Hotel Plaza, I never would have been able to make it through this entire ordeal. They were courteous, considerate, always there for me whenever I needed anything be it a recommendation exactly where to take my husband for treatment to extending our stay from day to day as we ended up staying for over two weeks, to asking about him every time I returned from the hospital, to translating Italian into English. They went above and beyond anything we could have expected. We will never forget their kindness and generosity in every respect and we would recommend this hotel to anyone who asked us. In fact, when we return to Rome, and we will, we plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some love ... LOTS of love”
Reviews.Author: spumoni
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so much potential. It could be the grand dame of Rome if someone knew how to run it and could put some money into fixing it up. As it is, however, it is wildly over priced and pretty funky. The location is fantastic. You can walk to most of the great spots of Rome with a little effort and you're mere steps away from good food, shopping, and things to do. As city dwellers ourselves, we appreciated being in the heart of Rome. Why come to a big city and get tucked away in some suburb? Get to know the place! The breakfasts were also quite good. Lots of selection, presented nicely. Our rate included breakfast so we ate well for free every morning. But the positives stop there. The service was atrocious. Probably the worst I've ever received anywhere in the world. The maids were friendly but the concierge and the front desk seemed to think it was an imposition to do anything for us. (Not that it should matter, but we're both well dressed, early 30s professionals.) This was especially troublesome because we had to drop-off and pick-up our key when we left and returned. I like the custom but not when I get a reluctant sigh every time I ask for my key back. Sheesh! The building is old and grand but in dire need of an upgrade. The rooms were obviously once elegant and technologically sophisticated. But half the buttons didn't work, the wall covering was dirty and looked burnt, the bed was huge and relatively convertible but the metal was rusted and flaking off. If we squinted our eyes, we could envision a beautiful room, but as it was, it was trashy. Also, don't believe the pictures on the site. There is no fancy rooftop bar (it's closed and difficult to get to), patios are overgrown with weeds and not much fun to sit on. Given the exchange rate, this was a huge waste of money for us. We had a good time but we were on our honeymoon and took the whole thing in stride as an adventure. But even if the exchange rate had been 1-to-1, we wouldn't have felt like we got anything close to resembling a good deal. If you have tens of millions of dollars you'd like to invest, I highly recommend buying the Grand Plaza, firing the staff, and renovating the building. Otherwise, avoid this hotel like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the worst hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: taylormadeLondon
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say.... this is my first review but i felt i need to write this in hope that someone elses trip wont be spolit by this hotel. On arrival was told the room was not ready. went to the hotel bar to have a drink and saw the barman drop bar snacks on the floor by mistake and replace them on the bar top!!! should have known how this stay would turn out. My room was a nice size but it was unclean and i found a few strayy hairs on our bedsheets and a funny smell that was to end up an old sandwich on the wardrobe from maybe the guest before us ! and i had a small private terrace that had empty cans and rusty seats to which while i went to freshen up in bathroom stained my other half's new dress! When i got to the bathroom i went to run a bath we had a suite with jacuzzi bath which the jets didnt work oh well i didnt expect there to be a jacuzzi bath anyway, But when i did run the bath as the and relaxed i went to drain the water from the tub and the bath would not empty so i called room service for the 4th time they sent someone who could not speak english up to my room and didnt know what i wanted him to fix so i pointed at bath and he left room and then i got call from front desk saying it would be fixed ASAP! we then went out for drinks and dinner got back to hotel late to find our bath still full of the same water that was there when i left and the same water that would still be there in the morning after!!! not on for a 5 star hotel 3 star or any other star hotel for hat matter! I went to speak to the manageress about the situation and was hopeing to move rooms to have a room myself and partner could shower wash in but she was the most RUDE person i have ever spoken too! and said it would be fixed and that she was not awere of the problem and why didnt i call front desk! after the day before they sent someone up! she said theres no note that i had asked to have someone fix our bath!! Now hoping that when we got back to the hotel after a day in sunny wounderful Rome, we would be able to shower again the bath was full of the same dirty water from the first day! i went str8 to the desk rather annoyied and demaned to speak to the Night manager and was told shes at home asleep and that i would have to wait till morning at this point i lost it and then i got allowd to use another rooms bath! Most unhappy! we the asked if we could book a car to the airport in the morning and was told no its after 10pm we cant books taxis u will have to find your own on the street at 5am! what hotel cant book u a car to the airport! The staff dont care! the rooms are dirty! and its not worth even thinking about staying i have been rome many times before and never experinced the type of people that hotel employied!! try the Eurostars International Palace or La Griffe Hotel not to far away from this hotel but Worlds apart service wise!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lv4rome
Reviews.Content: I decided to write this review so as to defend this hotel.I had many doupts about it due to the negative comments I had read on trip advisor.However the hotel proved to be very clean and peaceful.Having the BEST LOCATION,friendly and helpfull stuff,a variety of things to choose at breakfast and aristocratic rooms-like the amazing ballroom. Of course it is not a deluxe hotel-so don't expect ot find a pool and additionaly if you want to see a movie on your TV you have to pay 16 euros!but you will definitely enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable, friendly and excellnet location”
Reviews.Author: mamboNIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from first trip to Rome. Stayed at this hotel situated on the main street, Via Del Corso.. Very historic building with a beautiful ambience within it. Rooms were roomy and comfortable and very clean .. Staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The location is perfect walking distance to everywhere. Improvements could be made with the bathrooms - a walk in shower would have been appreciated after walking around in 35 degrees rather than climbing into a bath and holding a shower! Also a tea/coffee maker would have been nice. But I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Management Team Ever”
Reviews.Author: royalcoconut
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not bad, but the female hotel manager and the female concierge left me wondering if the definition of hospitality got lost in translation. As a hotel employee here in the states, I was really shocked by the lack of respect given to the guests by the management. My family had three rooms and one had severe drainage problems in the shower. My parents were told by the manager that there was nothing she could do about the problem....she did not offer to move the room or offer a discount. More importantly though, she never once said "sorry for the inconvenience" or anything of that nature. And heaven forbid you ask the female concierge for directions to anything!! I attempted to ask for directions to a landmark in Italian and she looked at me like I was the dumbest person alive. I know my italian is not that great, but at least I was trying. She eventually pointed to a spot on my map which turned out to be about a 15 minute walk from where i really needed to be. The other employees (bartenders, housekeepers, and breakfast room attendants) were personable and helpful and I hope they can remain untarnished by the influence of the bitter hotel manager. Many thanks to the young man working as a bartender in the rooftop bar. We were treated like royalty and he went out of his way to make my dad's drink each night - apparently there was only one bottle of his brand of Scotch on property and it was kept in the lobby bar. The bartender went back and forth to the lobby bar each time my dad needed a drink. "Above and beyond" service in my opinion since any other employee might have just said that they didn't have it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leggums
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visited Rome when I was a child we stayed at the Plaza. My father adored the hotel. He travelled the world, but to him the Plaza in Rome was the best hotel. I returned this year with my boyfriend, who had never been to Rome. We stayed at the Plaza a spoiling present from my mother. Nothing had changed, it is still like walking into a scene from Death in Venice, except it is in Rome. It has such a beauty, such a faded glamour. There are no mod cons here. The room had a yellow fabric wallpaper, the bathroom was still marble. We loved drinking campari sodas in the bar on the top floor overlooking to roof tops of Rome and the Spanish Steps, hearing the bells of the churches, how much more romantic can you get?i know why my father loved the hotel, the Plaza is a hotel of the old fashion traditional type, a true hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: AMNDublin
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in Rome... Great service, Clean quiet room, Fantastic breakfast but most of all unbeatable location

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel Badly Managed”
Reviews.Author: trav_uk
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 3 days in Rome with a stay at the Grand Hotel Plaza. The hotel’s strength is its location which is 2 mins walk from the Spanish Steps/5 mins from the Trevi fountain and 10 mins from the Pantheon. Location is A1. We had a family apartment on the 2nd floor as 3 family members were travelling together. The room size was very good and the outside space great to relax. That’s the good news - the state of the room and especially the common parts of the hotel were a disgrace. Our bathroom was not cleaned with mould in the shower - following a complaint the room staff spent 20 mins bleaching “an already cleaned” bathroom. We asked to speak to a manager and were told that no management was available as it was a Sunday – the manager would speak to us on Monday at 9am (more of this later). The room was extremely badly decorated with pain falling off the ceiling in the bathroom and paint over the power points etc. This is such a shame as the potential is fantastic. The breakfast is ok but is basically just bread based along with some bacon and eggs. The al l’carte prices displayed were outrageous especially given the state of the hotel. The downstairs rooms shown on the internet are fantastic and basically just shows off what the hotel could be like. They have no useful purpose though. The manager did not turn up at 9am to discuss the lack of room cleaning as promised. We did speak to him on check out to discuss why the rooms were not cleaned. He told me that this is a very unusual issue. I outlined the comments on trip advisor which would indicate that it is not unusual – he then said that he knew of the problems and had asked the staff to clean correctly but they were not doing so all of the time. I asked about the state of the hotel he said that some rooms on the top floors were being renovated however the hotel is privately owned and the owners did not want to spend the money i.e. they would like visitors to pay 5* prices for 2* hotel standard. At the end he offered a 10% discount which we accepted and then vowed never to return. Rome is a city to go out and see – my advice is not to stay at the Grand Hotel and to spend less on the hotel and more enjoying the city. If I were handing out the standards aware I would give it a 2* rating – funnily enough the manager also did not understand how it got 5 stars and told us that it must have been set sometime ago!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - Not A Whole Lot More”
Reviews.Author: ordflyer
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Plaza is centrally located and very convenient to shops, restaurants, the Spanish Steps, and is in a vibrant part of city center. Location wise, if you are going to stay in central Roma, it is great. The good news -- A) I managed to get a reasonable deal by booking directly through the hotel web site. An April rate of €198 per night for this hotel was a fairly reasonable rate (in my opinion). B) The hotel lobby is grand in appearance, but is mostly empty. It looks great, but they could do so much more with it. C) The food, as with much of the food in Roma is good. And if you don't want to eat in the hotel, just go outside and there are plenty of places nearby. D) My room was "upgraded" (see photos) and was fairly large with a large bath. The not so good news -- A) Noise, although I travel a lot, and stay in many hotels this is one of the issues that I struggle with. The hotel is old, so you have to give it some slack, but my room was too noisy. Noise from the street came through the window, but what was most disturbing was that you could easily hear the people in the room next door. When they were talking to each other, or on the phone you could easily hear them and almost make out every word. B) Hot water? Not sure what happened one day, but didn't have any hot water. Front desk was not very helpful and we never did figure out what happened or why. The next day it was back to normal. C) Internet, at a "reasonable" €15 per day compared to other European hotels, it was a bit temperamental and slow. It could easily be improved. All in all, this is a hotel that could benefit from a heavy duty makeover, improved service and if they could put these things together it would be a great place to stay. As it currently stands, if you get a great rate -- take it and you probably won't be disappointed. But it is unlikely to meet your 5* expectations if you have to pay a lot for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Lobby, Grand Location, Not So Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Plaza offers a fabulous location in a great neighborhood just blocks from the Spanish Steps. But beyond that, it is completely hit or miss...usually somewhere in the middle, but closer to "miss!" Some rooms are amazing, and some leave much to be desired. I was in Rome for a job, and stayed here for two weeks along with a contingent of fellow workers, so I got to fully observe the inner workings of the hotel. I see that one couple gave it a Five Star Rating, but trust me, this is ABSOLUTELY not a five star hotel. If you asked me if I would stay here again, the answer would be "possibly....if it is the best deal." Being located just blocks from the Spanish Steps, the hotel is in a great shopping and dining area...and that is the hotels best calling card! But other than that, the hotel needs a complete dusting and makeover. The hotel has a deep inner lobby area that is a visual feast, as you will see in the hotels website.... but it is never used, perhaps because there is no food or beverage service there. It's best for just...looking at when you check in... Our group was all maddened by the hotel internet service...sometimes it worked, and sometimes it didn't. The hotel staff was barely useful in helping us with getting it to work. As we were on business, this proved particuarly difficult and in the end, we went down to the Vodaphone Store two blocks away and bought wireless cards for two hundred Euro to work around the hotels intermittent internet service. This proved a difficult challenge for many of us. And the internet center in the hotel, with just two computers, was often broken or not working. So as a business hotel...forget it. I had a grand suite...although the television in my room would not work. The front desk staff is kinda/sorta friendly, but feels like they are in a deep slumber. Working here must be a job for life! My room would be made up....by about five pm every day...no one seemed in any hurry! So the bottom line is....I might stay here again...if I came with my own internet card....and I wanted to stay in a great location...but other than that...keep looking...you can do better than the Grand Hotel Plaza. On the positive side....it's the kind of hotel that someone could redo and make into a great hotel property....but that hasn't happened yet. Give it a try again when and if it ever does.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty first class in lack of the luxury touch”
Reviews.Author: harepus
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb location, everything is just outside the door. However, this is not a 5 star luxury hotel. This does not mean the hotel is bad, compared to Rome standard is this a 4 star. The hotel has a lot to do before ranging up among the Rome's finest hotels. The hotel is quite dusty with lots of stains and details that other 4 and 5 stars hotels would fix. The roof terrace could have been a nice spot, but reminded more of a ghost terrace. Service in front desk was arrogant and not very impressive. Concierge did not know much of what happened during night time. We asked for a romantic room and I was positive surprised, the room had lots of charme despite a very small size. Facing the backyard and the cheapest room they have, but still charming in old english flower style and old fashioned marble bathroom. Only way I would stay at this hotel would be a good rate as the location would beat most other hotels off.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Nightmare!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: super76
Reviews.Content: Please if considering staying in this hotel, read this review, then take my advice. I am in my 30's and stayed here with my girlfriend for four nights in July 2007. The 'Grand Plaza' provided me with the most disgusting hotel experience I have ever encountered. A stunning lobby and downstairs decor and a superb location.....where could it go wrong?? Firstly move to the bedroom floors and you will find a delapatated, stale smelling, run down, unmodernised and ill maintained set of rooms and corridors. The room i stayed in contained furniture that was falling apart, a toilet floor filled with leaking water, a shower that wouldn't be powerful enough or warm enough to wash a bar of soap and prehistoric air conditioning that did not work. It lacked style, comfort and feeling. The door provided little security and the safe resembled a childs' moneybox. (Please read other readers comments regarding the safe.) Breakfast ceased being served at 10.30. Unusually for myself I decided to make an effort and recover from a slight hangover and go to breakfst about 10.20. Lucky for me!!! Two days running at least 10 stunned guests were turned away for being no more than 5mins late. The entrance door was closed and locked, then manned by the head waiter. Rather than allow guests in, the waiter became involved in various very load and public shouting matches with guests trying to enter. These scenes were unbelievable, with well meaning guests and families being shouted at like prisoners and phsically being blocked from entering. My blood was boiling as the way these matters were dealt with was a disgrace. The guests were turned away, one set of which was literally 2MINS late!! The conduct was ignorant and undignified to the extreme. Further guest humilation was to follow as no food whatsoever was to be removed from the dining area. One by one guests were told to leave fruit, croissants etc behind and were screaned (visually) for innocently carrying out any items. Yet again a great public argument ensued with grown men, women and families being involved with very public and embarassing disputes. This experience was shared by many guests and was more akin to a scene from a prison. I personally filled my pockets with goodies and allowed my girlfriend to shield me from view!!!!!!!!!! The hotel staff have been noted in various reviews as being friendly and efficient. A bank manager smiles until you ask for money!!!! Firstly I had to use the internet service to book a hotel for the following night in Sorrento. It didnt work and the staff having informed me they would help on five occassions within an hour, did not make one attempt to assist me. I returned yet again to the main desk and was finally informed that the service was working and it was, wait for it, my problem I didn't know how to use the internet. The lobbly was quiet, it was 10.30pm. Honestly, you couldn't make it up. Reception couldn't inform me of what was the best way to travel to Sorrento simply replying in perfect English ' I don't know' before staring vacantly at me and holding a silence. This perfectly matched their outlook, ignorant, unhelpful, abnoxious, rude and devoid of all personality. This particularly applied to the stout, tall doorman, and the tall dark skinned man (I forget names now) who worked on the left hand side reception entering the hotel. He has been reffered to as 'the prince' in other reviews and remains one of the most dispicable people I have ever met. On leaving the hotel which was economy wise a complete rip off and a total waste of money, it was time to pay. I was travelling with a new maestro card that I had used to make the booking online with, and had handed over at reception at check in as per usual to prevent non payment. The cards details had been used successfully to book online, and been taken by the hotel. Probelm though, I couldnt remember my PIN. ( not asked for initially at reception) All hell broke out, now it was my turn for a public slanging session with 'the prince'. Couldnt swipe my card, couldnt use previous transactions, couldnt put it through manually, the manager was unavailable, nothing but a blazing row with me was going to suffice. Initially I was well mannered and composed and made great efforts to help. I explained that surely the purpose of taking my card at check in was to prevent future non payment and prevent any future problems. At this stage whilst trying to offer help the prince stopped listening and repeatedly pointed down to me shaking his head, stating over and over 'not my problem, your problem!' Enough was enough. I refused to foot the bill in cash due to the ignorance of this baffoon and when told the police would be called I erupted and encouraged him to do so. I wasnt going to be talked down to like other guests and be made a fool off in front of my gorgeous girlfriend. So after trading a great barage of insults that unprofessionally for him stooped into the gutter, the manager who was said to be initially unavailable was now very contactable by telephone. My passport details were taken and photocopied with both sides of my card. For revenge I complained vigourously on the phone to the manager about the conduct that I was exposed to and wasnt satisfied until I publically humiliated the prince for being incompetant for a good 5mins, before lifting my luggage and leaving. I think he gathered from my body language that I would have been more than partial to a bit of boxing before leaving. Anyway the point of my review is to completely discourage people from staying at this hotel. It is hugely over priced, dilapitated, has disgusting unhelpful staff, and is a huge disappointment all round. Generally I would not complain about much in a hotel and have stayed in the finest luxury to the lowest. I dont rate reviews that are negative for the slightest of issues however numerous but have been left with such a sour taste on this occassion that I felt obliged to. Read other negative reviews and then compare. A horrible experience. Ah well, at least I got some good lovin!!!! The big bonus is that payment still hasnt been taken!!! I think the hotels policy of 'not my problem, your problem' should apply to this case. It would be a shame to upset the prince again. He who laughs last laughs loudest.

Reviews.Title: “A prince at the reception desk”
Reviews.Author: AureliaParis
Reviews.Content: The person in reception was abominably rude and superior. The lobby is tacky. The first room we were shown was below all standards. The second one was renovated and very nice but the bathroom floor was filthy. It is old marble and needs a thorough mechanical polish and a good old scrub. The bathroom door frame was rotten at the bottom = mold. The shower cabinet was primitive, motel standard. The personnel make a lot of noise in the corridor early in the morning. The breakfast is all right, only they run out of food and it takes too long for them to fill the trays. They have big tables because they cater for groups occupying the conference facility. This is unpleasant for couples who would like to eat in peace. This is NOT a five star hotel until they renew ALL the rooms and hire nicer staff. The management has got it all wrong. The facade of the hotel is a disgrace. I would not go back. The rooms facing the inner court would benefit if the plants outside were better tended. This is sad, because under the right management this could be a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Globe24/7
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, Via del Corso and is right in the middle of it all. Close to all the sites and shopping making walking everywhere possible. That is where all the good things stop. The staff are rude and unhelpful, it would have been better off for the guests if they were not there. No smiles, no help and clearly no care. We felt as if we were disturbing them by checking in and staying there. The hotel itself was clearly once a splendid building both inside and out and it is still possible to see the reminders of this, for instance the hall on the ground floor in beautiful but was always empty and no atmosphere at all. You can sit there for ages and never be offered a drink. The rooms are, for the most part, pretty average and really quite dirty. Old sheets and pillows, old furniture and finishings and a carpet that needed replacing a while ago. The saving grace was the size of the bathroom which was great but once again needed cleaning. Rome has some wonderful hotels on offer but this is sadly not one of them. This could be one of the greats but at present it is a true disappointment. There are so many others on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Disappointment, Rome”
Reviews.Author: silverbrass
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment the Grand Hotel Plaza turned out to be. Such a grand name and reputation and such a total let down. The staff were surly and rude, the rooms were old and the plumming was pre 1st world war. It was so hot in our room at one point that we had to sleep with the windows open as the heating did not turn down and it was stifling in our room. The bathroom smelt of old gym kit, the pillows were like bricks and the television did not work. We happened to choose the particular weekend that Willem Defoe and his crew were filming and whilst it was very nice to see him strolling through the lobby, his crew were loitering constantly for the 2 days we were there, inconveniencing guests by stopping them in the lift for 10 minutes at a time and asking them to wait in a small room at the back of the hotel while they did a lobby scene. It was truly unacceptable especially as we were not even told that this would be the case! The breakfast room had been moved to a stuffy room at the back of the hotel and all of the contact numbers for the hotel had been switched around so as not to distrub the filming, only thing was that none of the guests had been informed so to get room service we had to call the hotel switchboard from our mobile phone as none of the other numbers were being answered. When we asked to speak to the manager about the sheer let down we felt, a man that did not speak proper English came to our door and seemed to think the whole thing was rather amusing - we were not impressed. You would expect this kind of attitude in a small 3* hotel but not here. Grand Hotel Rome, what are you doing? It's such a promising building full of expectations of romance and wonder. The ballroom is stunning (when we eventually did get to see it minus the lights and filming apparatus that had been tacked to the walls and ceilings) and with a large amount of consideration and money and staff training, this hotel could be wonderful, but for now, I would recommend taking your business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The most outstanding Hotel experience in Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: CanadaRome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Rome and spend the holidays - a dream I have had for decades- after four years of difficult or sad Christmases. We found the above hotel through Hotels.com. It is a 5* hotel from every point of view. Incredible location, wonderful rooms, outstanding service by every level of the hotel's staff. Wonderful breakfast buffets were included - which is one very important part of any vacation for me. Rome, in my opinion is a city of surprises. Every corner you turn in this incredible city you are met by a wonderful surprise of one kind or another. This is accentuated by the wonderful experience of having stayed at the Grand Plaza Hotel on Via del Corso.

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations”
Reviews.Author: Wynch
Reviews.Content: I had great expectations for this "5 *" Hotel, but unfortunately it did not deliver. The Hotel is quite grand, although it's in need of a lot of TLC and a good refurb. Our room was tiny, dark and the rug on the floor looked liked it hadn't been washed since 300 BC. We had only tepid luke warm water for our entire stay which was in a very cold December, so wasn't ideal to say the least! When mentioning this to the hotel staff nothing was done, not even an explanation or apology was given. We also asked reception for 2 extra pillows and an extra blanket which again was acknowledged but nothing was sent up to us! Our room was not cleared of used glassed in replacement for clean ones, nor was our minibar re-filled for our entire duration. We also tried on two occasions to use their Internet but on these 2 occasions their server was shut down for a while which meant you had to buy another card for 3 euros at a time (great scam!) Then on our departure on New Years Day we were told at reception that there were no taxi's and there was nothing they could do about it, we eventually made them book a private car for us, but we had to suggest it! The customer service at this establishment is appalling, the only thing this hotel has to offer is a good location, within3 mins walk from the Spanish steps and all the main shops (luxury and high street), 7min walk to the Trevi fountain. My suggestion to the management is to down grade this hotel to a 3 star to save clients like myself, the disappointment of having our luxury 5 star expectations crushed on arrival. Lisa, December 2007, UK

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the room 435”
Reviews.Author: naeAthens
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome 28-31 Dec 2007. We had a bad experience of Grand Plaza. The staff at the Receptionis was not helpfull and very rude, the room was dirty and in a very bad condition. The heating system was out of order as well as the mini bar. It is not a 5 star hotel. Maybe 3 star with a 5 star price. Unfortunately it was a bad experience. Don't stay thre specially at the room 435

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: skg0871
Reviews.Content: This hotel is grand, beautiful, staff are extremely helpful and polite and the service is impecable. Situated in Via Del Corso so take your plastic as Gucci, Versace, Prada, Fendi, Dior Bvlgari and many more are on this street. However, the main attractions are so close - spanish steps 2 mins walk, Trevi 10 mins walk, Pantheon 10 mins walk, Roman Forum and Colosseum 30 mins walk and the Vatican 50 mins - however, there is a taxi rank outside the hotel and very cheap so getting about if you want speed is great. Rooms are so big and spacious with marble bathrooms, high ceilings and really beautifully maintained decor. A real must for anyone wanting affordable 5 star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edtrainer
Reviews.Content: I agree with the characterization that the hotel has faded grandeur, but we loved our stay there. The staff were amazingly helpful. Our luggage had been lost and they found it for us (a much greater task than it sounds in Italy). One day we returned from walking Rome and were extremely hot, the concierge sent us up cold bottled water--probably because I looked like I was going to die! We loved the location. Right out the door and you are minutes from whatever you want to see. We were able to walk everywhere. For those places a little too far -- we took the bus. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Grand Plaza Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shoppholist
Reviews.Content: The hotel should immediately cover four of its five stars! It was clear for me when I was waiting at the reception that I should have believed the guest reviews written about this hotel and with my review I try to help new guests to choose better ,bad feeling started from the reception ,the staff "working" there, nothing seems to work with the clients check-in and out, the clients were very angry,the room was dirty, even the coins from former clients were still on the dirty carpet. The staff at breakfast are just cleaning the tables and the guests are standing by the emply coffee samovar and empty plates.At this hotel you don't get value for your money at all. Never in my life I have stayed in such a horrible hotel with 5 stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Both good and bad”
Reviews.Author: TNS-CA
Reviews.Content: The good: The hotel has a GREAT location. You're walking distance from pretty much everything in Rome. There's a bunch of shops and restaurants all around and all is accessible. The hotel breakfast was good and the rooms were ok. No horror stories! The staff was very helpful and courteous. They were very friendly with our kids. The bad: We had booked a car to pick us up at the airport through the hotel and it never arrived. We waited for 30min at the airport but then just took a cab (which was half the price of the car). The hotel staff apologized and allowed us to check into our rooms early which was nice since we have 2 kids under 4. The rooms were decent but the daily cleaning was very basic. The hotel is beautiful but obviously needs refurbishment and renovation. Some friends that were staying there asked for a triple but they got a double with a sofa instead (which the hotel considers a triple). Overall: We had a great stay in Rome. We enjoyed the city and the great weather. We saved a bunch on cabs by being in such a central location. Hotel was definitely not the best I've ever stayed at and more like a high 3 star low 4 star than a 5. But, like I said, it was decent, small, and friendly. Unless I find a better hotel with the same location, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost.”
Reviews.Author: tnkbstr55
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently in this hotel coming off a cruise. We paid 306 EU per night (we were told this was a 15% discount as we had booked several rooms along with friends) and were greatly disappointed. First , the staff was indifferent at best. Furthermore, we arrived at the hotel about 10 am. We were told our room was ready but we would have to pay another 100 EU for access, or we could wait until the normal check in time in the afternoon. We have travelled throughout Europe and have never been asked to pay extra for a room already available. We felt this was outrageous. The room itself was of adequate size and the bathroom was updated. The AC worked well. But the room was dirty and needed painting (as did the hallways). Also, there was no soap in the bathroom. We found a housekeeper who explained the hotel had run out of bar soap so we should use the packets of gel placed by the bidet. The furniture in the room was dated and broken. The handle of the door to the room was falling off from the inside. The public rooms were much nicer. Particularly the breakfast room. The morning buffet was good but not on a level of the cost of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - below average service”
Reviews.Author: JWPMIT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, a walk from nearly everthing. The rooms were clean and spacious with high ceilings - a grand old hotel. The great room behind the lobby is magnificent but there is not much of an opportunity to sit there, the patio depicted on websites for this hotel overlooks cluttered rooftops - not very charming. The concierge desk was simply are greatest disappointment - almost without exception, we felt as if we were bothering the staff. Our recommendation, to overcome this flaw - be prepared to be independent, research restautrant, sites and attractions prior to arriving, you'll have a much better time. 50/50 that we would stay there again - there are other smaller hotels in the same area. Oh, one more, SKIP the breakfast option - eat out in a piazza!

Reviews.Title: “magnificent”
Reviews.Author: RaffaeleFilieri
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews present on this site before booking. Despite the numerous bad reviews, i decided to book the grand Hotel Plaza. Well, I made the good choice paying less than in any other five star luxe hotels. I was looking for a place with athmosphere, far from a snob modern business hotel. This hotel is not indicated for people who like to be treated as king, staff is composed by romans, which are very spontaneous and nice. However, if you have a bad attitude with them, they do the same with you. I did not find dirty rooms, and they are nice and spacious. Of course not all rooms are like the one advertised on the website. But believe me, the price you pay for is enough simply for the lobby, the ballroom, the lion, the history, and the public areas. They are wonderful, this building should be a museum, you feel like you are in an other century. The location is perfect and the rooms are not noisy. The lemon tree room is wonderful, I recommend this hotel for romantic gateways, and honeymoon travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Serious gypsy robbery problem in this area - no help from hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mystified
Reviews.Content: The robberies in the area are unbeliveable. When we got robbed, the hotel staff could have cared less and the police were worse. Only the housekeeper in the room was nice about it. Do not bring anything to Rome you don't want to lose or stay in a safer area than Via del Corso, if there is one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place- Beware!”
Reviews.Author: bluglo
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience we have ever had. The hotel definitely does not deserve the 4 stars it holds by any means. The rooms were old, which is not a problem if taken care of properly, which they were not because we saw other rooms in the same conditions and spoke to other guests who were having the same problems. Our bathroom toilet leaked. We told the front desk about this problem and it was never fixed. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, there were never enough towels or bathroom amenities. And the staff was horrible! They were not nice, not helpful, it seemed as if they were doing us a favor by helping us. They really did not care about anything. The only plus with this hotel is its location, which is the center. But, please save your money and go elsewhere, it is REALLY NOT worth it. Italy is such a beautiful country but unfortunately the Italians ruin it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel by any means”
Reviews.Author: GrammyNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Plaza and we were extremely disappointed in this hotel. Despite the fact that the public rooms are lovely, the location excellent and the breakfast quite substantial and enjoyable, the actual accomodations are truly inadequate for a four star hotel. The room was borderline shabby, needed painting and was quite small. The bed frame was dangerous and both of us were scratched by the sharp edge. The public computers never worked so it was not possible to use the Internet. The staff did not seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Grand plaza at christmas”
Reviews.Author: qwerky
Reviews.Content: My self and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel over christmas. The whole break was magical and this hotel definatly inhanced the experience. I felt like i was in a true wonderland for 5 days. The staff are unobtrusive but always there to help if you needed them. Everything in this hotel is luxurious and yes maybe it isnt quite to a snobby 5* standard but i would much prefer a hotel with soul and heart than one where i cant get away from people asking me if i need anything. If your not a snobby business person looking for all modo cons all i can say is OH OH OH Its magic!

Reviews.Title: “If you're American, stay away”
Reviews.Author: RParkerConnecticut
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a severe disappointment. Some of the main rooms such as the ballroom and dining area are really lovely and live up to the photos on website, but the rest of the photos are really dishonest and who uses the ballroom? The beautiful outside terrace? How about $18 for a TINY drink and they won't just let you sit there without hounding you. The main problem I found was the strong anti-American feeling there. It may be because they have a large muslim clientele there and they don't want to look friendly to Americans. The day concierge was the rudest person I have ever encountered in travel, unless he was talking to an Italian guest.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Plaza Roma”
Reviews.Author: BellaBellaChicago
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at The Grand Hotel Plaza in Roma this past August of 07,and had such a pleasant time we are staying there again on our return to Roma this August. I found the concierge desk helpful and effecient. The hotel itself is so beautiful I ran around the interior constantly taking phots with my digital camera! I am an architectural interior designer so my delight in glorious renasaince interiors is felt very deeply. The breakfast room is lovely with frescoed cielings d ancing above your heads,as the staff happily brings you a perfectly made capuccino. The breakfast selection is nicely done with healthy foods, as well as beautifuly made fruit crosatdas. As for the location,it does not get any more centrally located then this beautiful hotel. The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Novona and Spanish Steps are all right there at your feet! Don't forget to stroll to the local art galleries and of course the Spanish Steps have some of the finest shopping in the world!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: 5topher
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights too many last week. i had previously stayed in the Lord Byron & Sofitel. As someone who works for a tour operator and deals with contracting hotels i have stayed in several 5 star hotels in rome & worldwide. This was a visit unrelated to my work & an extra break so i was restricted by my budget. At a bargain 199 euros per night due to a special agent rate, this was 199 euros per night too much. I now realize that anyone who claims to have had a pleasant stay must have been on their first visit to a 5 star hotel and have nothing to compare it against. The better 5 star hotels were about 100 euros more per night and i regret not staying where i know the standards are 5 star and should have paid that bit more. I can only laugh about my experience ( and notably that of many others ). This hotel is filthy & discusting and only really appealing if your accustomed to the living conditions of a slum. Dark , gloomy, tired, dirty, obnoxious service and customer relations - nobody who stays here would ever return. My advice is to throw the coin over your shoulder into the trevi fountain ( as legend has it, it means you will return to rome someday in the future ), but pray as you do so that you shall never return to this hotel. 5 stars - In the UK or USA, this hotel would be shut down by the advertising standards assosiation for being grossly misleading. I have stayed in and paid a lot less ( 80% less in fact ) at simple pensiones that outshine this dump. I can't go into the details of my experience because it makes me so angry - just stay away - this place is like a zoo. Rome is great - this hotel is just a nasty side of rome that needn't be explored. nevermind being wary of the pickpockets around rome - staying in the grand plaza is the biggest robbery of them all.

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast in Rome”
Reviews.Author: snoopcat
Reviews.Content: Definitely a favourable review for the Grand Hotel Plaza in Rome. Staff extremely helpful and friendly, rooms quiet, spacious and opulent (great bathroom too), great location for attractions, bars and restaurants etc. Just a few minutes from Piazza di Spagna and Fontana di Trevi. Great to stay in such a great hotel! The location, the quality and grandeur of the hotel and the faultless staff made this a memorable vacation which was thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “no time”
Reviews.Author: PuncRok
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is magnificent. luxurious, beautiful, tastefully decorated with comfortable, well air-conditioned rooms (bathroom was particularly nice!) complementary breakfast was also flawless (definitely worth getting up at 7 for ) but this is all let down by the horrible attitude of (most of) the staff who have a complete lack of patience and politeness, making my partner and myself as well as other guests feel most unwelcome. however, the diningroom/kitchen staff were a very friendly bunch and made breakfast time most enjoyable. definately reccommend this hotel for a weekend break, but any longer than 2 nights i feel would be less than satisfying

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: jimmydublin
Reviews.Content: myself my wife and all my family decided to buy our parents a weekend in rome and put them up in a 5 star hotel - well, i dont know how they got there 5 star they must have robbed 2 of them. we all went over for the wkend to surprise them and we were all surprised to stay in such a kip. the staff are extremely rude, and never buy anything in the bar as it is a complete rip off €20 for a cup of tea !!!! the rooms are poorly maintained and general service is absolutely appaling.if you have already booked this hotel - cancel it straight away as it very bad value for money - in fact i found nothing positive about our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced "luxury"”
Reviews.Author: purrfect16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a rip off for the amount of money you'll pay. The location is wonderful, and the room was quiet, but that's about all it had to offer. The man who checked us in was rude and talked to us like we were 4 year olds. The Lemon Terrace was not as advertised - the bar was supposed to be open until 22:00, but we went at 18:00, all the seats were covered, and I didn't see anywhere that a bar could have been setup. The rooms were adequate at best - for a 5 star I would expect an iron or full sized mirror, but this room had neither - the only mirror in the bathroom. The shower drain hardly worked, after 2 minutes you were standing in a puddle. The info desk was always crowded and busy, I would advise they get more staff for it. If you have a lot of money to waste, this is the place for you. If you're an average joe like me, who saved up for what I thought would be a 5 star experience, save your money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “So disapointing”
Reviews.Author: ParisAnonyme
Reviews.Content: The hotel surely used to be a fabulous one, but is not anymore. We had a very cold welcome the day we arrived. No smile, no help : a complete desinterest which we were granted during the 3 days we stayed. When we asked the reception desk to recommend us a restaurant for dinner, one of the lady just answered "they are a lot in the area...". Even though we paid 340 € a night (rate without breakfast) our room (a triple one) was very very old and dusty and not that large. The carpet was threadbare and torn-down. For that rate we get only a shower (no bathtub) with a broken door, so that all the water splashed out on the floor. The hotel never fixed it, depiste our request, neither they had our toilet seat repaired. The soudproof was... no soudproof at all, so that we could hear our loudly young neighbours in the evening, and the noisy cleaning staff in the morning. Only the breakfast meet expectations... Poor service, old and uncomfortable accomodations for a fabulous price..... They should learn from asian our american hotels what a 5 star hotel and service mean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdpt
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel is in a great location in the center of Rome. The staff that we encountered were very helpful, particularly Elizabetta and Bruno. That is all the positive I can say! The hotel itself is definitely not a 4-star. I travelled with my sister and our elderly parents. We requested a room close to the elevator and a stall shower for them. Upon check-in they were given a room far from the elevator and a tub shower with no grab bars. After trying out 5 rooms to find a suitable bed without springs poking through (The beds were like camp beds-- no box springs) we found a suitable room for my parents. My sister and I took their originally assigned room, only to find that during the night the back alley it overlooked was used as a loading/inloading dock for night deliveries and when I tell you we were kept up all night with LOUD noises that is putting it mildly! The next day, after threatening to check out, we were given another room facing the courtyard which was much better. Things encountered in this hotel (honestly): no maid service the first day in my parent's room, a foul odor of sewage from their bathroom, an ugly metal closet in their room for hanging clothes, a ripped carpet in our room, broken shower door, dirty, really dirty curtains on the windows, a sheet thrown over a couch for a slip cover, broken desk drawer and to top it off--- moldy bread for breakfast after running out of rolls, just to name a few. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: CINDY259
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very pleasent stay at the Grand Plaza Hotel in Rome. I had already booked the hotel before I read any of your other reviews and was very worried after reading them. I can honestly say that we found the staff very friendly and helpful and did not have to carry our own luggage or see anyone else having to either. It is like stepping back a hundred years when you enter the Hotel, yes a little faded grandeur but there is so much more atmosphere here than in any of the other slick, modern hotels we have stayed at. The public rooms could compete with the Sistine chapel. We had an executive room which was huge with a seperate foyer, and though we overlooked the main street once the windows were shut it was very quiet. I would definitely reccomend it and cannot believe how it got such bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “six nations rugby weekend”
Reviews.Author: andy51
Reviews.Content: Stayed with adult family 2 x sons and wives for Ireland six nations weekend, Sons and wives had lovely large rooms, but my wife and I had a rabbit hutch, undersized and overpriced, PS don't buy in the hotel Bars 12 Euro for a Jamisions whiskey, and 8 Euros for a small bottle of beer, Loved the location and that area of Rome...AJK

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mocDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Plaza for three nights when Ireland were playing their last Six Nations rugby match against Italy. The hotel is located on the main street in Rome and is within walking distance of all sights and restaurants. Excellent restaurants within minutes walk and shopping on our doorstep. We had no need to use public transport or hire taxis for our trips out. Strolled each night to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain area and wandered up to St Peters Square within fifteen minutes. Just make sure you take the map supplied by the Concierge in case of straying! We had a twin room on the second floor which was, by far, the largest hotel room in which we have ever stayed . It was scupulously clean and was fully serviced each day. We ate breakfast each morning in the dining room and were very impressed. The staff were helpful when approached - it was extremely busy on the match day (also St Patrick's Day!) and a certain amount of the Italian temperament showed through when coping with dozens of Irish trying to get transport and directions to the Stadio Flaminio - aren't we all human! Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: jwlYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I've read quite a few of the reviews posted for this hotel and if I had done that before booking I might have been scared off. In the end I'm glad I wasn't. The public areas are very grand and ornate which gives the hotel a 5 star feel. The staff were very professional and obliging. However, the hotel was very quiet so I can understand in the height of summer the service may not be as attentive. I stayed in a double room on the 2nd floor and it was clean. There was, though, a lack of attention to detail which takes the edge off of the 5 star claims. Missing or loose drawer knobs, the toiletries could be better, poorly stocked mini-bar, a generally faded 3 star room feel. A bath would be good to soak in after a long days walk around Rome. The room was a good size, probably twice that of my room on my last trip to Paris. The location of the hotel is superb with all of the major sites within a 10 to 15 minute walk, and great places to eat on Via Della Croce 30 seconds away. I would say that the hotel is trading on it's public rooms for it's 5 star status. I'd say it was just about 4 star but it needs to attend to the details a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveleLV
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews I had to give my input. I have recommended the Plaza to friends for their honeymoon this year. When reading the negative reviews I wondered if the writers had stayed in the same hotel as I. Our family of four stayed there 3 years ago and have never had a better experience. Food and service everywhere in the hotel were excellent. We loved the buffet breakfast and always had excellent service in our four day stay. The view from the terrace is excellent. The history of the hotel is wonderful and the personnel go out of their way to ensure your stay is memorable. Our family suite was luxurious and we all slept better there than we did in London or Paris. The lack of a bath tub was not noticed as the showers are more than accomodating. The ammenities in the rooms were more than we would ever need. When preparing to check out we were even allowed to "tour" other rooms that were being cleaned. We were impressed by the size and cleanliness. Overall the Plaza was an amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Saving Grace”
Reviews.Author: polcat
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel by default on our recent honeymoon. We had originally booked at A.N.Other hotel close to the Vatican City however after only one night we left as it was hideous. Anyway! We arrived at Grand Plaza desparate for a little piece of luxury and that is exactly what we found. The receptionist was the most wonderful Italian gentleman, determined to make the rest of our stay in Rome memorable, providing us with a beautiful superior room which was ready immediately. Within 5 minutes of being in our room there was a knock on the door and there stood one of the staff bearing a tray of champagne and nibbles - I was moved to tears, after the experience at our previous hotel this was pure bliss. The hotel's location is perfect, close to the Spanish Steps and on the main shopping street, however it is very quiet so do not be put off by the central location. Food wise we only ate breakfast but this again was excellent. The waitress was happy to provide anything we asked for including hot Chocolate! One thing I would recommend is that you take an hour out of your trip one evening and use the roof terrace for a pre dinner drink. The setting is idyllic, so romantic. Although pricey it is definately well worth it just for the experience. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, the location is fantastic, the food delicious and the service impecable. If I had the receptionist in front of me he would get a huge hug at this point for turning what could have been a disasterous honeymoon into a trip of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: lejon
Reviews.Content: We originally booked this hotel before looking at any reviews and I panicked when I read them. We decided to give it a try as we could always move to another hotel if it was as bad as some of the reviews said. We were very pleasantly surprised when we were shown our room as it was very spacious for Rome with new carpets, freshly decorated walls and it was spotless. The bathroom was also very clean and roomy. Yes, there is some faded grandeur but that is to be expected. The architecture within the building was stunning in the public rooms and a very peaceful and pleasant place to relax and read a book. We didn't use the restaurant as we always prefer to eat in the local restaurants however the breakfast was fine with a good choice of food and the staff were very helpful and pleasant. Staff at the front desk were pleasant and polite. Romans are reserved and are never going to fuss over you which suits us. The location is perfect for both the sights and the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Lady???”
Reviews.Author: merechat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and were anticipatating a luxurious hotel. The advertisements and pictures we saw were obviously written quite some time ago. Yes, the location is excellent. The staff was friendly and helpful. But the rooms, while spacious by Europeon standards, were dirty and everything was sadly worn and in need of attention. Our bed frame was broken and we had to keep putting it back together. The lighting was very poor. The oriental rug and floors in our room had obvious crumbs, grit and lord knows what else on them. They were never vaccuumed or cleaned during our 5 day stay. Our light outside of our room was burned out when we arrived and finally changed after four days. Fresh flowers were dead in vases at the end of hallways and the water was slimey and green. This hotel needs to take some of the money that they are making from overcharging people to stay there and put it back into the building to make it as grand as it once was and could be again. I would not recommend staying here to anyone. I was ripped off!!

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful location, definitely Not a 5stars Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: maccarma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "Grand" Hotel Plaza for two nights with my teenager son for a weekend in Rome, early October. The Hotel location is extraordinary: in the heart of Rome, walking distance from Piazza di Spagna, the Colosseo and other local amenities. The Hotel itself is quite old, the building is charming, but it needs a dramatic renovation. People at reception were quite unfriendly at arrival, and we had to go to our room by ourselves and carry our luggage! Room was clean but very old, bathroom only had a shower and water just warm. Breakfast was just ok (not what you would expect in a 5stars), but it was frantic....when we went to the buffet and came back to our table a maid was already preparing the table for other guests!!!!! And never in my life I had to do a queue in order to have breakfast in a Hotel! Standard room at 380 eur per night is quite expensive especially considering the Hotel is definitely not a 5star, despite very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Not professional and as well management not honouring reservation properly”
Reviews.Author: Alcobar77
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation direcly with the sales manager of the Hotel, received an offer and confirmed by email our stay with them. Few days before arrival we called the Hotel to advise further details about our reservation and received a very unprofessional welcome and reply from the management and were treated as nothing by phone. The Hotel was overbooked during the date we booked and they kicked us out without providing any alternative solution. If you come you stay out! We don't suggest to book this Hotel at all. Terrible and totally unprofessional managed Hotel with very stressed staff and managers. Nothing to do with the beautifull city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “possibly the worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Smeagol
Reviews.Content: We booked despite reading several ropey reviews for the first part of our honeymoon. We arrived to surly, pompous and quite frankly ignorant staff, a disgusting hotel room and a concierge who didn't give a monkeys! On the first (and I might hasten to add, only) morning we stayed, we returned from breakfast to find our room door wide open and a man on a mobile, smoking a cigarette on our terrace - he left on being challenged and when we challenged the desk downstairs, we recieved no explanation or apology but were placated that we would recieve a visit from the manager - an hour later - stil nothing! We have stayed all over Italy in hotels varying from 1 star pensiones to 5 star Lux hotels and I have never been so disappointed and appalled by the standard of service, quality of room and lack of care and attention of staff. We checked out within 24hrs and booked into a fantastic 2 star pensione and blew the money on the rest of our honeymoon. I will never go back - don't stay here, the hotel was a great lady - she is now a "down at the heel mistress" with torn stockings, a superiority complex and an attitude problem!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Plaza was grand for us!”
Reviews.Author: MkeB
Reviews.Content: We had researched several web sites to make our selection, including Trip Advisor, Frommers, Fodors, Hotels, etc. The reviews for this hotel have certainly been mixed, and as such we had our reservations about this facility. I decided to call directly, and spoke with Paola, who gave me an entirely different impression, so I took a chance.
