We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival, and although some of the comments about the hotel being dark, and past its grander days may have some truth, the hotel was a total gem for us. First, I want to point out that the hotel staff was terrific, and went out of their way on many occasions to accommodate our requests. Both Paola and Carlo (concierge) were terrific in handling our requests for tour arrangements and restaurant recommendations. The room was VERY clean and the maid service was terrific, every day. We had wanted more room for our stay in Rome, and so we chose a deluxe room that could accommodate my wife and myself as well as our 17 year old son. I had also asked about a room with a balcony which they also accommodated at no extra charge. The balcony was more like a patio which we enjoyed every day/evening (see photos). The breakfasts were wonderful, plentiful and well served each day in a beautiful room inside the lower level of the hotel. When I asked if we could bring coffee to our rom, they quickly took care of it for us at no charge and added a few croissants to the tray as well. They were always very thoughtful toward us. We would highly recommend this hotel to others, and look forward to returning some day. Although the price to saty here is higher than average, the room and service we received was well worth the added cost for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers a Roma”
Reviews.Author: exeterny
Reviews.Content: I have had the immense good fortune of staying at some of Europe's finest hotels: the Ritz in Madrid, the Villa San Michele in Fiesole, the Ciragan Palace in Istanbul (to name but three). But this is not about me. I mention these hotels only to suggest that I have some experience of what a 5-star hotel should be. Unfortunately, the Grand Hotel Plaza (GHP) meets none of the criteria. Understaffed--what staff there is clearly resigned to a fate of fielding constant complaints from guests--dirty, in disrepair, this hotel offers nothing beyond its central location. That, and the possible amusement to be had by listening to the concierge field complaints from other guests--"no signora, we cannot make the water work in your room"--both face-to-face and via telephone, while you are waiting to voice your own. Imagine, if you will, the absence of functioning airconditioning on a hot August night and you will get the picture of the fresh hell this hotel is. In what other ways does the GHP fall short of 5-star status? Ask that of the guests humping their own bags into the hotel. Eat (if you dare) in the hotel's bar. Do you prefer eight-way hand-tied coil springing in your mattress? To be frank, until I saw the beds in this hotel, I had never really thought about what “inner spring” meant; to envision the beds here, think Camp Runamuck. Do you wish a tissue in your bathroom? If so, be frugal, since the airplane-amenity-kit-sized container goes quickly. Do you expect Annick Goutal soap, Penhaligon shampoo? This would not be the place to find them (think Portico and then go down-market). How about a bar of soap for the sink and one for the bath? Don’t be silly. Have you ever been in a hotel and needed housekeeping after, say, 10 p.m.? Better not need it here. (Another reason to avoid eating in the hotel bar.) Separate bath and shower (and, in the latter case, a shower head that can be adjusted above 4 feet)? Better forget it. There is neither world enough nor time to catalogue the myriad defects in the upkeep of the hotel. It would appear that the owners have decided that it is not financially attractive to bring this hotel up to true 5-star code. I suspect that the location, the "Grand Hotel" appellation, and the relatively modest pricing are, in combination, enough to keep occupancy rates high and them in Sardinian villas. Were this hotel outside Italy, I suspect it would be unable to retain its 5-star status. At face value, the room rates are attractive. But as my wife pointed out, from the perspective of price:quality, this is the most expensive hotel in which we've ever stayed. The GHP is a 3-star hotel. You’ve been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe this hotel was once "Grand" but not any longer”
Reviews.Author: ladyhamilton
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in the Hotel "Grand" Plaza. Whilst it may have been Grand years ago, sadly it is no longer and it is not worth the amount they charge. The decor has painted ceilings and old tapestries with dim lighting which makes it dark and quite claustrophobic. They do not understand the meaning of "service" at all. Our hair dryer did not work and we gave up complaining in the end because no-one came to fix it after 4 days of continuously asking. The concierge had no advice to offer on where to go, where to eat. It was a waste of time asking. Everytime you went into the lobby someone was complaining - leaky showers, water leaking through ceiling etc. The air conditioning was also terrible! Do not eat in the restaurant it is extortionate - they charged 22 Euro for 3 freshly squeezed orange juice in whisky-sized tumblers (the same cost 2.20 each in a side street cafe). In fact don't eat on the Via del Corso restaurants at all - they are rude, and a rip-off. Eat on the side street restaurants. The upside of the hotel was the linen was very clean on the beds, breakfast was adequate and the location for all the sites was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The real deal!”
Reviews.Author: JoneeHughes
Reviews.Content: This place is the real deal where the sense of place and history is palpable! I’ve stayed in a number of hotels in Rome in recent years ranging from the appalling to the sublime but for an authentic sense of Rome, the Grand Hotel tops the list. Walking through the swing doors into the lobby is like walking onto a film set with sensitively restored period features and a great atmosphere. In many other cities the massive ballroom adorned with frescoes and chandeliers might be a tourist attraction in its own right! The room and bed were comfortable, the breakfast enormous and the staff attentive but genuine with it. It is absolutely bang in the middle of some of the best shopping in Europe so be prepared to be seriously tempted! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrquentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip because I was fooled by the website and how nice the pictures looked. When I got here I was really disappointed. The lobby is dark and old and depressing. The rooms are not much better. The doors are so thin you can hear everything that goes on outside. The service of the front desk and concierge were horrible, and I had to drag my own suitcase upstairs. All of this at US$300/night! The complimentary breakfast is horrible. Everything was dark, gloomy, looked like it might have passed as "grand" in the 1950's. I will admit the location is great - right on Via Del Corso with great shops and close to Spanish Steps, but I'm here for work so I need the amenities and comfort of my hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Faded former glories but still a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mossyroof
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - a stone's throw from the Spanish Steps, lots of designer shops and lovely little restaurants plus it's only about 15 minutes walk to Colloseum and Trevi Fountain. The public rooms downstairs are very impressive and worth a look even if you don't stay in the hotel. So far so good but the rooms are in need of a refit as they are a bit worn in places. We booked a family room but they gave us a suite on the top floor which was fine. The fittings were pretty old but still comfortable and we had no problems with noise. So it's not top 5* luxury as it has faded from its former glories but it's still fine for the price. We did find the service a bit understaffed and not as welcoming as one might expect.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand Hotel Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Hiawatha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in May. Whilst the furnishings and decor are very grand we encountered a numer of problems that we have never encountered in similar grade hotels elsewhere. Our stay did not get off to a good start as when we checked in no assistance with luggage was offered. Our room was tiny with a sliding door to the bathroom. Only 4 coathangers were provided in the wardrobe and when we requested more from the cleaning staff they were very poor quality plastic type. We noticed breakfast trays with food left outside guest rooms for more than I day. In our room the toiletries were not replaced by the cleaning staff, we even had to ask for more toilet paper. Other problems included - Poor quality breakfast - cold coffee etc so bad we ate breakfast away from the hotel, inadequate room cleaning - dirty drinking glasses not removed, used drinks bottles left in room for 3 days. Despite arranging an extension to our stay as we had a late flight on our last day we were disturbed by housekeeping twice. Unsurprisingly there was no sign in the room of the usual 'Your comments are valued' type questionnaire! The Lemon Terrace is beautiful but,as noted by anoither member spolied by lack of staff to serve drinks. Overall, very poor value and we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the same place we're talking about?”
Reviews.Author: hankypants
Reviews.Content: I took my elderly mother to rome in september. I wanted the best for her - not just the newest most modern hotel like any other bog standard - i wanted something special. We got it. I found the rooms were fine. The bathroom was great - i gave my mother a facial in the massive armchair in there every evening. The beds were sooooo comfortable. We had no bother with the noise from outside - we shut our window shutters to keep out the noise and the light - maybe you only get shutters with a deluxe room. We found the staff to be very professional. They always helped with our queries with a smiling face. One evening another couple next door had a MASSIVE arguement. Actually we could only hear her - she was swearing and blinding and thumping or throwing things. When it didn't die down I phoned reception to ask them to sort it out and they came up within a couple of mins. I didn't hear a peep for the rest of the evening. The breakfast was to die for - we weren't hungry for the whole day after eating and you can order it to go if you have an early excursion. The hotel is 'grand' as it's supposed to be. I chose this hotel for it's grandeur. My husbands aunt who travels all over the world, literally, even the war zones - she goes to a different country about 7 times a year - she told me that even if I didn't stay at this hotel - it was worth a visit for a coffee because of it's beauty. She was not wrong. We really loved this place and yes while some of the furniture and decor was a bit shabby it was still quite beautiful. Now how do I put in what i give it for cleanliness etc? I can't see that bit on screen so i'll tell you... rooms 4 out of 5 service 5 out of 5 value 4 out of 5 cleanliness 5 out of 5 pool N/A Just an extra couple of tips...my mother is very elderly. I didn't want her walking far or having to hang around for buses etc. I booked a mercedes to pick us up from and take us back to the airport (i booked it seperately online). I also booked all our excursions on line and had us picked up from the hotel each time (dropping back was more difficult as it is a one way street so they drop you about 5 min walk away). I also booked the private guide of the vatican so we got in before the rest of the crowds in a small group. I got a car to pick us up at the crack of dawn!! We really had a fantastic 5 day trip and my Mum was totally in love with the whole kaboodle. There had been terrible storms while we were there and when we got to the airport the previous days flights had been cancelled and everyone had a terrible time. Lots got money stolen from them and one elderly couple had money stolen from their wallet by a taxi driver! We didn't have this - I think the mercedes cost us 50 euro each way - I think a cab costs not much less than this anyway so it's worth the couple of euro extra. The driver will help with bags etc.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is !!”
Reviews.Author: galere
Reviews.Content: We went to Roma for 4 days in May 2006. The city is gorgeous and the weather was fantastic. Hopefully because we could not have spent much time in the Gran Hotel Plaza - Via El Corso. The building is very nice since it is very old and all ceilings are beautiful. However, the hotel in itself is not worth a penny ! We have paid 350€ per night and my husband and I were very upset : except the fact that we have been witing about 3 hours for our room to be ready , the service was really bad. Nobody helped us carry our luggage when we came in and did not bother either when we left ! The room was dirty with cigarettes ashes on the desk and chairs. The shower curtain was broken and despite our several calls nobody even bother to come to repair it. The persons at the reception were not nice and polite. We finally decided to ask questions to people in the streets rather than to the reception who did not bother to give us any complete info. A last but not least, the hotel is advertising a lot on its terrace which is supposed to be great. We went there at the end of May and the weather was great but the bar was not open and when we ask why the answer was : "too much work with tourists!!". believe me go somewhere else. That hotel is worth 2 stars only !

Reviews.Title: “Best made bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am like the princess and the pea where hotel beds are concerned.Of all the beds I have slept in, the best made beds are to be found at the Plaza; they are perfection! for cleanliness and quality and crispness and whiteness of the linen. The pillows are puffed and the bed is an irrisitable invitation to put off sight seeing! even if you order a humble camomile tea with room service it is presented on a crisp white napkin. One feels spoilt; try it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: S.Cool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned two days ago from the Grand Plaza on Via Del Corso and loved it. If you don't want a building steeped in history, if you don't like rich fabrics in your room or over 16ft tall ceilings, then this isn't the place for you BUT, if you do, you've found your home in Rome. This hotel is not for those who are looking for a new Holiday Inn type hotel, this building is, I believe centuries old. Beyond the marble lobby area you will find a grand salon where you can relax with a drink or coffee while you sit under frescoed ceilings or perhaps have your breakfast in the ballroom that is fit for royalty. The staff is always ready for anything you need or questions, reservations or simply directions. If you have a room that doesn't have a balcony, just go up to the 5th floor Lemon Terrace and relax while looking over the rooftops of Rome. We have traveled many places and some of our journies are very hectic, this is the one hotel where we can actually relax, get a good nights sleep in a very comfortable bed and feel refreshed to begin the next day. Our friends stayed in a different location while in Rome but came to our room at the end of each day to unwind, relax and have some delicious Italian wine, before heading out to dinner. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Family Loved the Grand Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and three of our grown children (boy 18, girls 22 and 25) spent 5 days at the Plaza the third week of February on a short family holiday. I have traveled heavily throughout Europe on business for the past 25 years and these days usually book on Internet travel sites, but in this case I called the Plaza directly to discuss the best room arrangement. They suggested a double for my wife and me and a second room with a double bed having a small room off of the entry hall with a sofa that converted to a bed for my son. That worked perfectly and saved me from renting a third room. Since there were five of us with a lot of luggage arriving from JFK, I asked the hotel to arrange to have a van pick us up at the airport. This was slightly cheaper and much easier than getting two taxis or trying to grab a mini-van taxi. The rooms were near each other on the 5th floor and were comfortable, quiet, modern and spacious. The bathrooms were very large and the fixtures seemed brand new. The hotel lobby, the lion and the staircase are spectacular and classy, but not new. The breakfast room is beautiful with fresh flowers on the tables with a lot to choose from the buffet. You can order non-buffet breakfast, but we didn’t bother. Unless there is absolutely no alternative, I never use room service, hang out at a hotel bar, or use a mini-bar, so I can’t comment on those aspects of the hotel. The location is perfect and we walked to many sites. There is a taxi stand across the street and the Metro is a few minutes’ walk. There is wireless Internet in the lobby, but the site hits you for 3 euros an hour (I use my Palm Treo for Internet and e-mail anyway these days so I no longer have to lug around a laptop or rely on hotel connections). The kids wanted to see Pompeii and the concierge was very helpful in assisting us in making arrangements for a car and driver to take us to Pompeii and Sorrento. This turned out to be a good decision because a bridge on the main highway was closed unexpectedly that Saturday morning and traffic was crazy so if I had rented a car and driven myself I would probably still be lost. Also, with five people, this arrangement turned out to cost about the same as a bus tour (which I took last year on my own and it was absolute torture) with Sorrento and an English speaking driver/guide thrown in to boot. We did not have the guide in Pompeii itself as this was not his “turf” so we rented the audio sets and this worked fine. My wife and I enjoyed our stay very much. My daughters, who have both traveled extensively, loved the hotel and had no complaints other than they hate hotel hair dryers. My son never complains about anything, so I am not sure how comfortable he was in his fold-out sofa. My one complaint about this hotel is that our waiter in one of the restaurants they recommended tried (unsuccessfully) to convince me the service charge was not included if I used a credit card. My pride was hurt because I didn’t think I looked that stupid. I complained to the Plaza and the management expressed surprise and told me they would discuss this incident with the restaurant personally. In general, we all had a great experience at the Plaza and plan to stay there whenever we can get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: manghino
Reviews.Content: Guess I ran in the worst experience of my whole life. Arriving from the aiport on a sunny bright day entering this dark underlighted hotel made me feel cheated on both price ( over 300 Euros/nite) and extremely poor quality of rooms. Tremendous smell coming from public toilets on ground floor and from my bathroom. Room service took 45 minutes and bed filled with ants. Walked out the next day to book in a real Hotel up the road. One suggestion : ran away before you're checked in!

Reviews.Title: “Vile, dirty, expensive and rude”
Reviews.Author: Fidofelix
Reviews.Content: I booked in for a Christmas treat - a splurge. And it was certainly expensive. I refused the first room as it was filthy, dark and tiny. I was moved to a nice bright room at the front of the hotel. On Christmas day the bar and brasserie were shut, so I went out for lunch. When I came back my room was full of ants which were marching up and down to my dried fruit basket and box of chocolates from a hole in the floor. I phoned reception. Nothing. About 20 minutes later I phoned down again and a maid was sent up with an aerosol spray of ant-killer which she liberally applied to my christmas presents and everything around the ants' path. Holding my breath I marched out and to reception saying they must be joking if they thought I was going to sleep in those fumes, and demanded another room. Reluctantly they moved me to a rather gloomy suite. During the move they "lost" an expensive scarf. I had to keep reminding them to look for it - and the reply was 'Have you tried asking housekeeping?' On my last morning when I asked about it they shrugged as though I had a nerve to ask them for it. To add insult to injury they never replaced my lost gifts and gave me no rebate for the inconvenience (and the price is phenomenal). On the night before my departure they gave me some free fruit - 3 grapefruits and a pineapple. Really convenient for travelling. As for the hotel: The ancient baths were painted with gloss paint! The beds had a plastic undersheet so it was like sleeping in a steam room. The pillows were like bricks. There was no internet access. The public rooms were once magnificent but have been let go to ruin. There is no service in them and they are lit with fourescent light. The breakfast was dismal and stale. The restaurant was shut throughout my stay (Christmas!) but meals could be eaten in the tiny dark drab bar. The room service - one side salad with a sachet of salad dressing, 2 roast potatoes and a glass of wine cost more than a 3 course meal with wine for 2 at Numero 34, a local starred restaurant. I moved to the Sofitel for the last 5 days of my stay - gorgeous, clean, comfortable and much cheaper, with a charming staff. The manager at the Grand Plaza is supercilious and condescending and acts as though you are seriously wasting his time by being there. AVOID THIS HOTEL. IT IS VILE AND IT IS A RIPOFF

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: NYC10023_88
Reviews.Content: I did not mind the high cost of this hotel because I assumed the quality would be high. That was a huge mistake!! I thought the hotel was shabby when we arrived but that was not the problem. When we arrived at noon, our tv did not work (not a big deal) but our toilet did not flush (quite a big deal). They told us they would immediately take care of it. THIRTEEN hours later, when we wanted to go to bed, they told us both were fixed. They lied. When we showed the manager neither was fixed, he just said they would fix it the next day; they did not even offer to give us a new room - in fact, the woman at the front desk said there were no other rooms available and suggested that we use the public toilet 3 floors down. After MUCH discussion, they finally gave us a new room; it was an upgrade so I suspect they just did not want to give that to us. Eventually after much debate, they gave us a discount, but we should have not had to fight for it given the shoddy room and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but they could do better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortune to have our double deluxe room reservation upgraded to a suite, so we began feeling very good about this hotel. We didn't know quite what to expect as we had read very contradictory reviews after we booked! The location if fab (except that fact that the immediate vicinity is somewhat de-valued by McDonalds) The taxi dropped us at the next corner (some rubbish about one way streets) not a huge issue because the hotel was 30 yards away. It was a bit disappointing to have to drag out cases through the revolving door because there was no porter waiting outside. Check in was efficient and the upgrade completed we went up to the 4the floor suite. The view was fabulous and the suite was huge. Beds & furniture all very clean & new. NO BUGS . Bathroom was very nice and no smells. The breakfast was excellent (typical European selections and plenty of) but the bacon & potatoes were luke warm & plates cold….deduct one star. There is definitely some maintenance needed and you don’t have to look very far for bad repairs to the old décor. Light bulbs missing from public areas etc lets the whole thing down. It’s not the place to stay if you need access to modern features, internet etc. but fine for a romantic week for your 27th wedding anniversary!! You do get the feeling of neglect which is a great shame. The roof terraces could be a great asset but they appear to have been forgotten and the evidence of poor upkeep is never far away Overall we enjoyed our stay but this hotel could be “grand” but at present it’s not and it’s a great shame. The staff were very polite & helpful to us. Finally, stay away from the bar…the mini bar is far cheaper. My wife, who is no stranger to designer handbags, visibly paled when she saw the bill for 2 Campari & Oranges!
